review_title: New style remote.. otherwise it’s the same.
review_text: I don’t write reviews often, but I learned a few tricks that solved issues I’ve had over the years. I hope this helps others with seemingly unsolved issues with firesticks.Firstly I’ve been using firesticks even before 4K TVs and they’ve almost always have worked well. The occasional restart/reboot on older models were something my family got used to. I eventually replaced all older units with this 4K version. And now never have to reboot. Although this has slightly better remote function, it’s essentially the same as the 2018/2019 version. The 4K Max has the spec bump and quicker less congested WiFi 6 configurations.Okay, so my biggest gripe with the firestick had to do with it not always playing HDR or Dolby Vision, which defeats the purpose of it being a 4K model. I’ve scoured tons of forums and looked at countless YouTube videos regarding this. But either the solutions didn’t work, or they would only be HDR 10 when the nicer Dolby Vision was available.SOLUTION: Make sure your 4K tv setting are set properly. Go into “INPUT” settings and find the HDMI input you’re using for the firestick and depending on your model make sure “UHD” is toggled on. This solution finally allowed every content I’ve played on all streaming services to finally play Dolby Vision content (and HDR when DV was not) every single time. I hope this helps.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2021
author: Ben U.

review_text: The positive:This new generaion fire stick is faster than our old stick. The old one has struggled with the new major update Amazon did and the buttons were worn. The updated processor and increased memory helps.It is really nice having the volume controls on the remote. The two batteries load in a more traditional way as well.The negative:I really wish they made the four quick buttons on the bottom programmable. We ditched Disney + and would much rather have it pull up youTube, HMO Max, or Discorvery +. Oh well.I don't like the new update. I now have to go to the Amazon Prime app to see my purchased videos, where before it was built into the main menu. I also have zero interest in the live TV and believe that is what was dogging down the old Fire Stick. The ad space on top is also a lot bigger and when I search a movie it's not telling me if Netflix has it. I ended up purchasing a movie to watch that ended up being on Netflix.

date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021
author: Desiree

review_title: Desperately needs an app only mode
review_text: This new 2021 interface that Amazon pushed to all its devices makes the device near impossible to set up for a parent or older person. There’s no way I can explain that 90% of the screen is an ad to my elderly parents. At least with the old interface, the recent app row was above the ads. Now there’s a banner ad and a suggested row before getting to the large app icons that they can actually see.Outside of a 3rd party launcher, there’s no way to make this usable for someone that doesn’t understand technology. Luckily the new googletv interface offers an app only mode. That’ll be my go to from now on. A once great eco system of FireTV devices is now more ads than function.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2021
author: Dan

review_title: Works fine. New buttons work. A bit faster. So far no WiFi 6
review_text: Upgrading from the "old" 4K Fire Stick which will go to my son. One star off for the "WiFi 6" capabilities as I have an ASUS RT-AX86U router with WiFi 6 and yet my new Firestick shows 5GHz with very good signal strength. It works fine and streams fine but I would like to see my FIRST WiFi 6 device showing that it is using all of that extra speed, heh. The boot-up, app boot, and remote are slighter faster. The navigation ring on the remote is a bit stiffer than the older one (does not butt change stuff when you sit on it tho!) The Netflix, Disney+, Prime buttons all work fine. Getting all the apps signed in AGAIN is a pain so I wished that would automatically get moved over with some sort of sync but it is a one-time pain.Full-time HDR and Dolby vision pops up on most stuff. Easy to connect to a network. Does 8 bit, 10 bit, and 12 bit HDR and is selectable. Audio sounds great but I just use stereo headphones so cannot tell much difference from the old oneShould you upgrade from the old Fire Stick to this new one? Nope if the old one works well. A little faster, probably better WiFi reception and some extra buttons are not worth it so far. I just needed another one.
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021
author: John E. Pombrio

review_text: First off, delivery was quick and the driver was friendly and that is about all I can say that I enjoyed of this so far. The Firestick doesn't seem to want me to stream movies in full screen. I have a QLED TV and now I lost part of my screen with the firestick. Previews will be full screen but once you hit play, not full screen anymore. Don't have this problem with a Roku which is what I was replacing to get an upgrade I thought. Can't log into AMC+ with your existing account, it will make you setup a new account and pay double the money. I already paid for a year and will use my existing one. Amazon seems to be acting like Apple and want to control the apps and where you spend the money. My next move is to return this and get the latest Roku 4k stick. I have tried all the online fixes that were suggested and problems have persisted.

author: Amazon Customer

review_title: Arrived broken, after 3 hours talking to Amazon it's still not being replaced!!!
review_text: DO NOT BUY FIRE TV DEVICES!!! CHOOSE ANOTHER STREAMING PLAYER BRAND!!!Worst customer service experience in my life from Amazon!!!! Amazon sent me a completely broken Fire TV 4k stick! From day one the audio cuts out entirely after a few mins of playing a video, and does not return until stick is physically unplugged from power. Then it cuts out again. Problem occurs in all video apps, and I tried full software restore, plugging into multiple different TVs, as well as different audio connections (direct to TV through HDMI, Through receiver, through bluetooth on multiple devices.) And my other Fire TV 4k of the same model works fine in this same TV, so... THE STICK IS BROKEN! So I contact Amazon through their chat interface and Parmish is a total disaster at helping me. I tell him that I have done a full software restore on it, at which point he responds that I need to do a full software restore. Ya know, the thing I just told him that I did already. Then I tell him I have already tried plugging the fire TV directly into the TV with no sound receiver, and he says "well than what I need you to do is plug the fire TV directly into the TV with no sound receiver." This happened over and over. It was like a bad joke. But I wasn't laughing. Finally after about an hour of this nonsense he decides that my Fire TV stick needs to be replaced. Then he says I "Have no card on file", what ever that means. So after about 10 more unanswered and ignored questions to him about just what he's talking about I finally figure out he means my Amazon account has no credit card on file. But it does have a card on file. I log in and verify this. The card is up to date and working, and amazon had just charged it that day even. So I tell him this, and he responds that I need a credit card on file in order to send out a replacement, even though it won't be charged. I tell him again that the card is on file and working, and he says it need to be updated. Even though it does not. So I hit "edit" on my card info on file, and resubmit the same working card. Parmish sees this on his end and says thank you. Then he says I need to update my OTHER CARD on file. I look and there is an old credit card from 6 years ago on the account from a bank I no longer use, and its not even selected as the active/favored card, so It doesn't even matter that it there, but I delete it anyways just to be sure. Then Parmish says I need to reenter and update that old card (that I no longer bank with) in order to get a replacement sent out. At this point I'm done with Parmish. The whole conversation was absolutely ridiculous! I say "thank you for the help but I need a supervisor. Please transfer me to a supervisor."So Parmish transfers me to Vikas. I ask Vikas if he is a supervisor and he says "no." (Are you surprised by this? I wasn't.) So I explain that I was suppose to be transferred to a supervisor and ask that Vikas transfer me directly to a supervisor. And I'm transferred to Annal.I ask Annal if they are a supervisor, and they answer... get ready for it... are you ready... they answer ..."No" !!!!!!!!! They &^^&%&$^^%^ answer "No."So I close the chat window I just wasted over an hour on and I call Amazon. This is where the real nightmare begins. I start off with a regular customer service rep and I ask her to transfer me to a supervisor right away because this will be my 4th attempt to get a supervisor. She is very polite and gets me a supervisor on the line write away. I explain the entire issue with the Fire Tv 4k Stick and everything I have done to troubleshoot it already YET AGIAN, and the supervisor apologizes for all the insane trouble I've been having. She sounds like she really wants to help me, asked some more questions, and then tells me that she can't replace this particular model because its out of stock. I had just checked the stock, so I knew it wasn't out. I checked it again, and then told her it appears to have plenty of stock. She verified what model it was again, then said "oh yes, I guess we do have it, let my put you on hold while I try to send you one." She comes back a while later and says "the system won't let me send you one. I have to transfer you to a Fire TV Specialist, buy I'll get you a manager there as well.So then I have to go through the whole thing again with this new Fire TV Specialist person. She keeps putting me on hold to check things over and over again. And she has me do crazy things - For example, she insists I go to my TV, unplug the other working Fire TV I now have in there, and plug this broken one back in, then load it up and read the serial number off of it to her from the info screen. Why? Doesn't she already have that info? She should. And WHY AM I PLUGGING A $25 DEFECTIVE BROKEN DEVICE BACK INTO MY $2,000 FLATSCREEN??!!! I don't want to do that. I shouldn't be asked to do that. What the hell? Then she keeps checking to see if I'm still in warranty. REALL???!!! I JUST got this stick in the mail. I JUST GOT IT. How long is the warranty period that she has to keep checking on.. 5 hours after purchase. Also, this is a brand new model that just came out. HOW COULD ANY OF THEM POSSIBLY BE OUT OF WARRANTY??!!Finally after 3 HOURS of talking to people about this and a final, particularly long hold while the Fire TV Specialist person tries to figure out if I can be sent a replacement - I give up. I tell her I'll just return it instead - just so I can just get off the phone. But I'm NOT returning it - That too would probably turn into another huge nightmare. It's not worth my $25 for all this aggravation. So... I'M DONE. This is ridiculous! After speaking with a total of SIX people for over THREE HOURS.. My brand new Fire TV 4K stick in now in my trash can and I'm never buying a Fire TV product again. All Amazon need to do was have me send in my broken one and then send out a replacement. That's It. They could have sorted out all their serial numbers and insane data requirements after they got my stick back. AS a customer, I simply got something in the mail that arrived broken and I wanted it replaced soon after I got it. How simple of a transition is that? But instead I got this torrent of poor customer service and bizarre data mining. SO.. Officially.. I'm no longer a Fire TV user.I'm currently switching my entire smart TV ecosystem for the entire house over to Google's Android TV now, I've had it with Fire TV, and I suggest you do the same. Android TV systems don't suffer from the same app limitations that Amazon does (IE with Fire TV you get access got about 12% of the Android apps available to the rest of the Android TV world, Even though Fire TV runs on Android, and you can install what ever apps you want on your Android TV device without having to TRICK IT into installing it), it still works and runs apps (like playing a game or looking at photos) even if your internet connection goes down (Fire TV becomes a useless brick without constant internet), and the whole thing just seems to run better. I don't have time to deal with Amazon's nightmare anymore. All I needed was for Amazon to replace the broken Fire TV stick they JUST sent me, and they can't even do that. So, ummmm... BYEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!

review_title: Hey, It's a Firestick - None Better
review_text: This is the third Firestick I have bought and I love them all - I wanted one in the living room and bedroom because air TV is terrible in my area. Also take one on my travel trailer. They only need a TV with an HDMI slot, a nearby electric plug (some work on USB) and a decent WiFi signal. If you can't get WiFi, the Firestick is not for you. It opens up a world of possibilities for what to watch. Works well with Amazon Prime, Hulu, YouTube TV, and many other subscription carriers for much less than satellite or cable. Installation is easy and working the remote is simple.

review_title: Great value and price. Easy to install and use. A must have!
review_text: I dont know why I've waited all these years to get a Amazon Fire stick? I've had Amazon prime ( plus Netflix and Hulu for many years and recently added HBOMAX ).I've been using my Xbox360 and XboxOne to stream my media up untill now. It only took minutes to install and once I downloaded all my apps and logged in to my accounts and was easily accessing all my digital media. The picture quality is great, I'm using a older Samsung TV but it works with the 4K new firestick no problem. Easy to use remote controller. Dont wait. It's easy to install and use and a great price and value.

author: Alex

review_title: Capable Streamer. Grab one when deeply discounted
review_text: I had an older 4K firestick that appears identical to this one except for the remote. But this one is MUCH faster in terms of on screen use. Very snappy performance. Picture quality is very good too once you turn OFF the always on HDR, which will turn the picture to mud. It's on by default for some reason. Also make sure 4K is turned on (or auto) if you have a 4K set... Which presumably you do since there is no reason to buy this Fire Stick if you don't. Is it worth $50? No, but for half that price, heck yeah. And with a new 4K stick coming soon, discounts like that are probably going to be common...so cash in when you can.This probably checks every box you have. 4K. Dolby Vision. all forms of HDR, a voice remote with buttons that controls all essential TV functions (volume, channel, mute) with dedicated Netflix, Amazon, Disney+ and Hulu buttons...So if you have an older stick, and a newer 4K Dolby Vision set, going to this stick is a no brainer.The only downside is you have to download all your streaming service apps again, digging out the names and passwords of each one. A major pain. Amazon keeps track of everything else, including your wi-fi network, so not sure why it cant do this too. But it does not for some reason, despite a step in the setup process that sort of implies it does. If so, that process did not work for me.I know the new version of this stick is upgraded, supports WIFI 6 (which I have) and Atmos (which I don't) But can't see its worth twice the price of this one.

author: Larry

review_title: Unit sets up in a snap
review_text: Had a fire tv from 5 years ago and Hulu and it didn't play nice so got the stick. Installed it per the little get started sheet and it asked if the Tv was a Sony, was the sound bar a Sony, and then it installed itself. Right from the get go the remote worked the TV the stick and the sound bar all turned on or off with just the remote. It streams lots of things in 4K much to my surprise and it looks really great. It handles the sound well also. Amazon recommends hooking it to an HDMI/ARC. I hooked it to the sound bar which then runs to the TV and into an ARC HDMI port. Hulu live plays nice with it and Hulu live didn't work on the Ruko device I tried before getting the stick at half the price. I highly recommend the Stick 4K.

author: T.R.P.C.

review_title: Worth every penny, but buy it on one of their frequent sales.
review_text: I have 2 of these now, so I don't have to deal with my kid swiping the one from our living room TV. My 60" Sony is a first generation LED, and has a few smart features, but no streaming services, etc. So the Firestick, with all of its features, suited my needs perfectly. I picked up the 4k on sale, cheaper than the standard one was the first time around. Second time around, it was about the same price, with a sale price, and some credit I had from something. The only issue I have had, is a remote died on the first one I had. It stopped working, except the volume controls. It was about 3-4 years old, and fairly light use. No spills or hard drops, etc. Ordered a newer replacement remote, and the swap was mostly easy. I had to power off the Firestick a few times before it would recognize the new remote. We use ours for viewing, Amazon Prime content, Disney+, Funimation, Crunchyroll, HBOMax, and there is plenty of free or semi free content to stream as well. The Alexa part of it functions as you would expect. She gets it right most of the time, and sometimes you just have to scratch your head at what it comes up with.

review_text: I had an original fire stick and liked it well enough. It was getting a little laggy and started spending a good amount of time buffering. I was starting to get a bit frustrated with it. So I upgraded to the 4K. I couldn't be happier. No buffering and it loads channels considerably faster. I wished I had done this a long time ago. author: Kevin Crandall

review_title: Our prior Fire TV Stick was almost perfect, but this generation is even better.
review_text: As I’ve said before in these pages, we’ve tried Apple TV, Roku and YouTube TV and without question, Fire TV beats them all for not just a much-appreciated array of FREE programming, but for the intuitive ease with which you can explore everything they have to offer. Memo to the other guys … simply offering an abundance of content in your platform is seriously worthless if you just throw it all in there with no thoughtful organization for your customers to follow - and to return to when we want to!!! Fire TV Stick does that very well.And fyi, I just bought the new Fire TV 4K Stick and was concerned whether my older TV (10+ yo SONY) and the new Stick would communicate. They did and I’m now poised to enjoy the Stick even more when we get a new TV in a few months.Do I recommend it? I could babble-on for the next hour telling you why the answer is yes, so suffice it to say IMHO, it’s the best thing out there in its Class.

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2022
author: The Batman

review_title: An improvement over my old FireTV
review_text: So after a couple years of use, I needed to upgrade my old FireTV stick (2nd Gen). It was running out of memory for the apps. Also the stick always glitched here and there because the processor was being stretched to it's limits. So I decided to upgrade to the 4K Fire TV Stick and was getting a discount that made the cost less than $25. Had this stick now for a couple months and I am very happy!What an improvement to start! Menu flowed faster, WIFI drops were non-existent and videos didn't lock up as before. That's because the CPU was improved (from an older Quad-Core 32bit that ran 1.3 to an improved CPU that runs at 1.8Ghz) and the memory is doubled (1GB to 2 GB). Did I mention there isn't a re-learning curve as the menu system is pretty much the same?The best thing, is the process to reload the apps from the one to the other is one shot. Unlike when you get a new computer and have to reload your programs or apps one at a time manually, the Fire Stick will do it for you when you attach it to your account. The only thing it didn't remember was the previous Stick's settings.Now with all that said, I did run into a problem.... the remote wouldn't program. But I was able to use my older remote and had a chat session with customer service. 20 minutes later I had a new remote being sent (1 week) and when I got it, worked like a champ.Now I'm ready if and when I have to replace my TV to 4K :)
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2022
author: ChrisInJesup

review_title: works better than the last 3 - buffers alot
review_text: Movers lost one of my previous ones. I purchased an Amazon 2 item special in 2018 and initially they worked well and then started failing to connect to Amazon Home network, which they must do first before they can function (guess all they show you is in the cloud). I wrote poor reviews on them, Amazon service was horrible, proved with a portable Roku (which I really don't like) that the internet service and TVs were not the problem.This device has very little connectivity issues and the Alexa voice on the remote works as well as before. I do like the voice and side app loading capability of the FireStick - think it's really the best device out there - if it works correctly.I have noticed in the last 30 days quite a bit of 'orange circle' streaming buffering. I've tested the TV again and also compared to a Roku TV on the same network, the network down is 526 mb (promised 500 with ATT) and the Amazon Firestick is the only device with buffering issues. Other than that, it updates automatically and regularly as promised, and worked great for many months until recently.Thinking as mentioned on a Bluetooth adapter review, that the way a Firestick works is to 'phone home' and connect up with the Amazon Cloud Firestick Home network before it does anything, I suspect that Amazon Web Service is having on-going issues and that's the cause of the buffering issue. Nothing else on my network has a buffering issue.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2022
author: Dave in Texarkana

review_title: Great Upgrade from the non 4k Stick
review_text: My 3 year old Fire Stick was driving me crazy. I had to reboot it, on average,every 2 days. The voice would often get out of sync with the picture and there were many times when it would simply pout and not perform as intended. I got a notice about the 4k stick being on sale so I checked the reviews. I saw many people happy with the 4k stick and how most of the reboots, freezing and out of sync issues were corrected. I was somewhat skeptical but knew that I could return the stick if I was not happy with it. But happy with it I am!. After several weeks of use I have had no issues at all!. Great gui, flawless streaming, voice searches...everything works well!
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2022
author: Joe. Silva

review_text: My previous fire stick would play jeopardy on its on. Meaning I’d click the button on my app once and it would scroll mindlessly. My tv and stick were both handed down to me. Stick had a remote, but even with battery changes it just stopped working. Didn’t make sense to purchase a new remote, especially with the jeopardy scroll.Looking for the best deal, this was like $8 more than the lower version. Actually picked it up at target, same day hack with no min order for the win.Here’s the thing. I though I read everything good enough, but the buttons on the remote confused me. Yea I know I get it. Clearly + & - mean what they mean. But I was SOOOOOOO HAPPY, when I put 2&2 together and realized I now have a tv remote as well!First off. One remote will always be my preference. But to think “nawwww that’s not what it is” and it to actually be it. Man I was thrilled.Now my son can completely do everything on his own again. He’s 8, but with no remotes I had to use my phone to constantly change or click continue watching. He could handle going up to the tv and turning it up. Even better, now I don’t have to jump up in the middle of the night to turn the tv down because I forgot. Or stand and wait at the tv to see if the level is too loud, go back to the bed and check to see the level.Single mom, we share a room. This has been a very pleasant game changer!Everything works great! That I’ve used lol I’m now “becoming my parents” with technology so I’m still figuring out what the new features are.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2022
author: Lina Valencia

review_text: We bought the latest version of the 4K Fire TV Stick because we wore out our old one (especially the 'enter' key).We didn't expect much except getting another stick that worked fine. Instead my wife and I both noticed immediately that the picture on our TV was much better! Also it did not hang up as often with streaming. I attribute both these effects to faster and more sophisticated processors (and software) with each generation.Also there are new Apps which seem to be associated with the newest stick only. One which we use frequently is Amazon Music. That was yet another pleasant surprise.Well worth the upgrade even if you don't need to do it. And I note that the new stick is often on sale.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022
author: NCBreeze

review_title: Old Fire Stick remote failed again 3x so Finally upgraded- WOW!
review_text: My wife was blown away with how much clearer, brighter, and vivid the picture was once we installed this 4k Unit on our at least 7 year old 42" TV. With an Amazon Show about 3' from the TV I don't know how much I need the Alexa button on the remote but I suppose if we want to be one step closer to Orwell's 1984 sure, why not... Except, will it be the government or corporate tech giants that invades our lives?It has been proven not only if you put a frog in boiling water it will immediately jump out, but also if you put one in tepid water and slowly raise the temp they will also eventually jump out. But human beings are just being lulled into this... sure, I'll gladly sacrifice my personal space for you to know all my discussions, internet activity, where I go and for how long at each location, soon to integrate my health details and all, not to the government but voluntarily to all these various tech companies. But I digress; Overall, we are happy with this upgrade. Bring on the fact there are more IOT than heartbeats in my house now.... by a factor of 4.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2022
author: Chris

review_title: Great Addition To Any TV w/ Hi-Speed Internet
review_text: This newer version of the Fire TV Stick is faster than the 2nd Generation I have. It installed without a hitch & was up & running quickly. The addition of the 4 buttons at the bottom was a much welcome new feature. The only button of no use to me was Netflix. Thankfully, it was easily remapped & now pushing the Netflix button can launch any app I want. I chose KlowdTV. The remote is a bit slippery to hold so I'll be ordering a silicone case. It also does everything Alexa can do by talking to the remote & her response comes through the TV's audio system. For examle, you can pause the show you're watching to ask for a weather report, turn on a smart light or ask how old the actress is in the movie by just by pushing the remote's microphone button & making the request. Amazon Alexa devices also respond to commands to the Fire TV Stick after linking one or more. Pairing of the remote happened seamlessly. Pushing the power button on the remote turns on or off my Samsung TV & Yamaha receiver. I'm also using an older Samsung 50" TV as a 2nd monitor on a PC in the basement. The FireTV remote can turn on the monitor & change the source HDMI port from PC to Fire Stick just by pushing the mic button & asking. Bottom line is that this a great device!
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2022
author: darkNEskies

review_title: Makes a Smart TV a Genius TV
review_text: This might give you the same feeling you had when you saw your first plasma tv! Even if you have a Smart TV, you can take your tv back to school because this Firestick brings a whole new level of knowledge. Once you see it, you won’t go back. Think of your current Smart TV as a CD player. It has a few apps (that may or may not buffer a little). This fire stick is the new digital music player that is clearer and has a ton of new capabilities; this is just with your video watching.The remote control will control all of your Alexa devices!But my favorite is simply turning the tv on and saying, “Alexa, turn on the Goldbergs in Hulu.” It’s like I’m back in the simple times of cable when you literally turned the tv on and turned it right to the channel you wanted to watch, but now you only use your voice.

I was paying Xfinity scammers $131 for 10 channels all new slow internet. every month my bill went up. It did my heart good to cancel them today. author: annette michelon

review_title: Work great on all of my subscriptions except Paramount +
review_text: This is my 3rd Fire Stick. They all work great except on Paramount + which I is the main reason I bought it. I thought being the newest model it might work on P+ when my older Fire Stick and Fire Box would not. I have 3 Samsung TVs and 4 Amazon Fire devices and Paramount Plus will not work on any of them The App installs and comes up. I can see all of the available shows. I pick one like Star Trek Discovery. Some background music and video comes up. I can open the Episode Menu but when I pick an episode it spins around a few seconds and says it needs an internet connection. It is like this no matter what show I pick on P+. From what I read this is a common problem with Fire Sticks and Samsung TV's. I have tried all of the fixes that I can find. I don't believe it is the fault of the Amazon Fire Stick. It works great on Netfilx, Disney+, Discovery + etc. There is one fix that I read where i have to change the DNS on the Fire Stick to match the DNS one on my router. That is a bit complicated and I should not have to do it and I don't even know if it will work. Paramount+ needs to fix their app. Has anyone else had this problem and found a positive soulution?
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2022
author: Okiejon

review_title: FIRE TV STICK 4K IS FAB - CAN'T IMAGINE A HOUSE WITHOUT ONE!
review_text: We love our FIRE 4K TV Stick! Definitely faster than our older HD FIRE and the expanded collection of applications/content are just impressive. It lives happily in the back of our Yamaha AV receiver and within a few minutes of updates and re-authorizations of accounts - we were in business!Amazon makes a big deal of Alexa and voice navigation. We don't use it. Our hands and the remote short cuts are perfectly fine.Although we are an Apple household - there is nothing to compel me to spend 4X more for a marginal improvement in conveniece (Airplay screen sharing specifically). There are a number of work arounds, which are all satisfactory in our minds. However, tbh - Amazon could make this device more agnostic and make those of us who live in the Apple universe to be even happier.Lastly, we have found the video/audio quality of what we stream via the 4K Fire Stick to be great.Buy one and you will not regret it!
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2022
author: J. Olin

review_title: Impressed with user experience and value.
review_text: I bought this to fix my older Samsung TV's lack of speed when executing commands on native apps (esp HBOMAX). I was going to buy an Apple TV box, but decided it was too pricey.The Fire TV stick was the perfect solution and integrated seamlessly with my older TV. It was simple to set-up and use- plug, login, play, and go! The display quality is top notch, voice commands work flawlessly, and the app selection and ux fluidity are great. HBO Max works normally now as well. This little $35 device literally breathed new life into my older TV in a blink. I have to say I'm impressed on the value it delivers.I only have one element I'd improve, the plastic used on the controller doesn't feel as good to hold as smoother, polished plastic (as used on the control wheel). The matte plastic isn't terrible, but there's something about it that doesn't feel good in the hand.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2022
author: MPGboss

review_title: Fabulous! Saved me $500 or more! Read My Review
review_text: I have Fire Stick in my bedroom on my Sharp TV of about 10 or 12 years old. Firstly because the TV is only 48" Sharp no longer supports this TV. I ran into a big issue on my fairly new living room 52" Vizio. I am old school and spending $500 on a TV for me means I will have it in service longer than 10 years. Hulu recently changed something or upgraded so whatever they did would not work on my TV any longer, my Vizio. However that old Sharp TV is still running Hulu without issue. I quickly deduced that the Fire Stick was the difference between the two. I quickly ordered the Fire Stick for the Vizio in the living room. Thank you so much Amazon. I love my Fire Stick. I love the ease of my Alexa app I tell her to find a program for me and she does it. But most of all she just saved me $500 or more for a new TV. I am sure the FCC may come down on Hulu for this blocking us Old Schoolers from getting an app we pay for. A $25.00 investment saves me five hundred or more dollars. Thank you so much for this.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
author: Mema

review_text: I had purchased Roku’s for my 5 TV’s in my house but then our city installed fiber throughout the city but Roku’s would not work with it. So I replaced all the Roku’s with the Fire Stick 4K. These have been working great with the new high speed service from our city and I haven’t had any issues with them other than finding channels that the city says we have access to through them but I can’t find. Not a Fire Stik issue though. What I really like about this product is that we use a sound bar with our large TV and I always had to turn on the sound bar separately but the Fire Stik recognized we had a sound bar and when I turn on the TV, it turns on the sound bar. Makes it easier. One thing I have noticed that I don’t know if it’s a provider issue or the Fire Stik but the TV commercials are significantly louder than the show making us mute the TV during commercials. Our previous product did not do this but we were also using Xfinity with them. Now I have 5 Roku’s that I need to do something with. Maybe put them on EBay or something because they are all nearly new. The Fire Stik 4K is a good product and is working well for us. Even though these are working well I kind of wished I had gone with Fire Stik 4K Max with WiFi6 for later upgrade to WiFi 6 but that’s later and there will probably be something better out there then.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2021
author: Scott Wilson

review_text: I recently decided to give Fire Stick a try as I have been using Google Chrome on my bedroom TV did a few months. I did not enjoy using my phone as a remote with Chrome. Fire Stick comes with a nice little remote control, laid out fairly well, although a bit too light and small on big hand. The button placement makes sense and convenient along with the Voice control that works well.The app it’s self scrolls and operates quite seem less. Connect to all the various stream app services waa also easy to do, using your phone to basically verify the logins. I’m some cases as long as the phone is connected to your network and you open the app your wanting to connect on the Fire Stock, it will automatically detect this connection.Also access to new app based services for even more content if one would like to pay Amazon for these. Will continue to use Fire Stick in the future.

author: The Grubb Show

review_text: I was skeptical about this thing because I had a Roku back when Netflix and Prime Video were the only things people were using. But, I have a 7 year old LG UHD TV and the TV still works great, but the SmartTV capabilities are super outdated… I can’t even put HBO Max on it. The stick has more than I was expected, not only was I able to throw HBO Max and Peacock on it right away, I found a CNBC app that I love and I just slapped Pandora on it. I’ll never have to switch my input to listen to music on our stereo system. We moved out of Xfinity’s service area so we really miss the voice remote; the voice function works pretty much the same was as Xfinity’s voice remote. Thanks for providing a great solution to my problems, Amazon.

author: liztron

review_text: I got rid of my old Fire TV when we got a PS4 years ago. The PS4 is on it's last leg and sounds like a get engine and the Smart TV we have has a great picture, but it doesn't offer the same apps that the Fire TV offers, so I grabbed one of these as a cheap solution and way to watch our premium TV apps (HBO Go and Shotime) without them being drowned out by the PS4. It's a great solution for us since we don't need a new TV and a PS5 is still impossible to get. Added bonus is I love the interface for Spotify and watching podcast videos or having the lyrics on the tv while I clean is nice. It is faster than my 4 year old tv or PS4. Minimal issues with streaming quality and pretty fast processing. Exactly what I needed.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2022
author: Kindle Customer

review_text: This was for our primary living room TV where we have limited wireless signal in spite of having a wifi booster just 20 feet away. Our streaming would buffer and/or pixelate periodically and even using the Prime home page was a battle. The basic fire stick we replaced was four years old and we figured all the problems were caused by the fact that we have 20+ other items sharing our bandwidth and the fire stick was just wearing out or inadequate for the available signal. So we decided to try the 4K one to see if it helped our streaming quality, and man did it ever!!! Every page and app snaps into place quickly and so far we haven't had even one instance of buffering during a movie or show. Love it! We have three other TVs with fire sticks and as they wear out we're upgrading all of them to the 4K.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2022
author: Paul Watson

review_title: Easy set-up and like the TV controls
review_text: I have an older Samsung smart TV connected to a Samsung soundbar in a bedroom. I was using it only to stream content using the smart apps built into the TV. With the age of the TV the apps were no longer getting updates and were getting slow. I was using a Harmony remote to turn on the TV, switch to the apps menu and turn on the soundbar. Well, the Harmony support is going away too. (Old electronics!)This Fire TV Stick worked perfectly to update the TV.After simple set up, the power switch on the remote turns on the TV and soundbar then goes immeditately to all of the streaming apps that I want. The volume control works perfectly with the soundbar. The Alexa integration using the remote (pressing the blue button) works for selecting content but I haven't been able to have it control the power function. It has also been a little irregular when using the Echo device located in the room. But that's just bonus functionality in my book.

author: JA-Columbia

review_title: WORKS FANTASTIC! PUTS FIRESTICK BASIC TO SHAME WITH A MAXIMUM 3.5 MBPS INTERNET CONNECTION!
review_text: I love this 4K Firestick! I have the disadvantage of living on the side of a mountain in a very rural area in the Foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains of North Carolina where the fastest internet speed available is through a 3.5 Mbps maximum, (3.04Mbps lately) via AT&T DSL and this Firestick streams high-definition video at that slow speed! It looks great, especially compared to my previous Firestick Basic model. The clarity of videos are absolutely amazing! Did I say I love my new Firestick 4K? I wish I'd bought this model as my first one! The Firestick Basic was annoying and never showed high-definition video like this one does! I'm amazed at how they can get this clarity with a 3.5 Mbps internet connection!

author: Floyd C. Fox

review_title: Very affordable way to have a state of the art smart tv
review_text: Installation couldn't be easier. How does it know everything it knows....somewhere between awesome and scary. But face it. If you ever struggled programming a remote, a VCR, a TIVO etc...it's really just remarkable to have this remote automatically discover and operate your TV....to find your network, and make it simple for you to connect it to that network....and then to boot up nearly instantly. And - about that remote - super intuitive and friendly, and the voice control works (although think of the level of "smart" as about what a four year old would have ). Interface is similarly smooth, intuitive and nicely aggregates all of the disparate apps that make up today's golden age of TV "cord cutter" ecosystem.

review_title: Took a chance because I have satellite internet, amazingly surprised!
review_text: I really didn't think I would be able to watch anything because I have satellite internet way out in the middle of nowhere, and I was seriously surprised!! It works wonderfully and I am able to get a few local channels that were removed from my dish TV line up. There are a TON of free channel apps so you can watch a ton and I mean A TON of FREE movies, TV shows, etc. I still haven't been able to filter through them all yet, but I am in love with this firestick!! Thank you so much for blowing my mind!!

review_title: Better, Quicker, More Responsive than Older Models
review_text: The Amazon Fire TV is a device that integrates well with in the Smarter Home. The newer model aside from 4K offer more memory and performance to earlier models. I picked mine up on sale to replace an older unit that had become sluggish and also draining batteries too quickly.It could have been related to wear or sticking buttons, but on sale this was a great option as opposed to just replacing a remote and hoping most of the issues went away.Both Amazon FireTv and Roku are great additions to an older TV with HDMI to make the Smart. I have both, but find the Fire TV has more add-on apps to meet a variety of needs.

review_title: Use this if you don’t have a smart TV
review_text: I’ve had a couple Fire Sticks previously and they worked ok. Best Buy didn’t have the standard Fire Stick in stock so I was forced to buy the 4K version even though I don’t have a 4K TV. First world problem, I know. This version seems to stream a bit better with less buffering/loss of signal than the previous stick. So from that aspect it worked good. It also took WAY less steps to hook it up to the TV than the previous versions. Another improvement. Hopefully I won’t need to purchase again. But if I do I’ll get the 4K version regardless of if I need that high of resolution, just for the better streaming quality.

review_text: This is the only streaming device you need. It will extend the life of your smart tv. Has directv app and Disney plus supports Dolby atmos both of which my LG Oled doesn’t do.Somehow I can control the firetv menu with my lg control. Although sometimes I lose that functionality. Really love that the remote is now synced to my Tv’s volume & power button.The built in one touch Prime/Hulu/Netflix & Disney + buttons are awesome!!!!!

review_text: Why didn’t I switch years ago? I would have saved thousands! SO many free options on top of the few streaming services I pay very little for. Never a shortage of choices, and I can still watch the news. I went from one to four within a couple months, because why not have one for every tv? One money, done and done, and everybody gets to watch whatever they want with NO buffering. Now we can even watch tv when it’s storming (or when there’s a hint of a tiny puff of a cloud five towns over), which we could never do when we had Direct TV for almost $200 PER MONTH! One month worth of cable money covered the cost of all our Firesticks+cute glow in the dark skins. Hands. Down. the best money-saving move I could make!

review_text: I purchased 2 different Fire sticks. I don’t see the difference between the more expensive and the cheaper fire stick; however, I am extremely pleased with both. I ordered them Sunday night and received them the next morning, 8:00 am and well packaged. They were extremely easy to install and now At 65 years of age I’m streaming and I love it!! One other note, I had an old fire stick that I switch to a non smart TV. Initially, it was difficult to program but with persistence, it too became easy to install. I now have streaming in all rooms of my house. With cable, I could only afford two rooms. I recommend them!!!!!

author: Vivianna

review_text: I got this as a replacement for an older version that finally died. I had been bad-mouthing our internet provider for months as the Firestick kept losing connection. Come to find out, it was the firestick that died. Since getting this newer model I have had no problems, and the picture seems sharper than it was before. I don't know if the Firestick has anything to do with picture quality or if it's just in my head. At any rate, I am very happy with this new one. It's also nice to have dedicated buttons for some apps AND the TV volume control.
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2022
author: BJS

review_text: This is my 2nd 4K Firestick for a total of 5 various Firestick models that I own. I travel for work and Firestick is a great way to be able to watch your usual tv stations while away. I first purchased one because it has the Dishnetwork app but since then have found so many uses for it that every tv in my home has one. This one was actually purchased for my Epson projector. To my surprise the remote actually will turn the projector on & off but also controlled the volume as well! At this price point you would be silly not to get one. I may buy another just to get the extra remote with the tv controls as the remote is usually $29 alone.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2021
author: David

review_text: At the recommendation from a trusted friend, I purchased the Amazon Fire TV 4HD Stick with Alexa remote control. I have been amazed at the speed and accuracy of this device and can for the first time cancel my expensive subscriptions (first to cable) and satellite tv services, knowing that I will not be limiting the number of choices to great tv and movie services; in fact, I will have more options than before! And, with the option to access my Wi-Fi to my phone's hotspot feature, I no longer have to pay for internet services anymore as well. A great buy and even greater entertainment offer!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2022
author: Joseph M. Fazio

review_text: Arrived the same day I ordered it. I don't use Alexa, she annoys me. Easy to set up. Super smooth, no buffering. Remote operates both my TV and older Sony home theater system (volume, mute, on/off). I was worried about this as I am getting ready to cut the cord, and my Comcast remote was the only one I needed for all my devices. Now I can put it in the box with the rest of the Comcast gear when I send it all back! One issue I didn't expect though. I previously had my cable connected to the input of a 1 X 4 4K HDMI splitter which in turn mirrored the cable broadcast onto my main Samsung 4K UHD TV screen, and 3 other devices: another Samsung 4K UHD TVs, a 2007 vintage Panasonic Vizio, and a pre-4K Epson 2150 projector. Only the Samsung TVs worked in this configuration, although all devices worked when connecting the Firestick directly to the device's HDMI port. When I switched out the 4K splitter for a regular HDMI version, all devices worked. Of course, I don't get 4K video now, but I honestly don't see that much offered in 4K yet anyway, especially in terms of live TV, news and sports.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
author: Tami

review_text: I received a Fire Stick last year and just recently installed it and tried it out in one room. I fell in love! Fired my cable tv connection (saving $50 per month) and ordered one for another room. It is a little challenging figuring out how I can watch my live tv regular channels but I am working on it. I am a news addict so I have to figure out how to watch Meet the Press, Sunday Morning with Jane Pauley, Face the Nation and 60 Minutes live. It is possible to watch them later in the day or next day unless you pay for an application like Paramount +. I believe I could also get an antennae. I have to research and explore but for now am LOVING all the free movies and fabulous connections with Amazon Prime which I have always had. I highly recommend getting a fire stick and start a new savings account for all that money you will be saving.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2022
author: Susan R

review_text: This is such a stress saver. I bought a brand new Vizio Smart TV this in 2021 and ONE WEEK later they lost their contract with Netflix so that app was rendered useless. So I purchased a Smart Blu-ray player with apps to compensate. The apps crash on both devices so often that they are all but useless. They load slow and crash fast.A good friend recommend this Firestick and it has solved all those problems instantly. No crashes, quick loads, 4K quality! We plug it into any TV with an HDMI port when we travel and BANG just like being at home.I love this product!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022
author: Richard S. Barber

review_title: How to locate desired program content
review_text: works very well using Alexa because the sheer massive content of streaming is a bit overwhelming. The visual quality is outstanding and the selected channel is very high quality. The learning process to locate a specific streaming destination is a bit daunting until one gets used to it. The unit cost is unbelievably low so I expected a lower level of performance but no so, but with no reservations. Only time will speak to reliability but the unit appears to be well constructed and with Amazon backing a safe purchase.My cable bill dropped from $200 +, down to ~ $50 per month. Nuff said?.

author: Harry Wert

review_title: love this thing - ditch the cable company
review_text: I had no idea that I could do so much with this device by adding additional app and APKs. I had a Roku and I like this better for the most part. It's easier to use and easier to add apps, plus it's a lot cheaper. The one thing I like better about my Roku is that it had a jack for headphones so if I'm watching in bed, I can plug in my headphones and not disturb my husband. I wish Fire Stick could do this. The Quick buttons can't be changed which stinks since I don't use Disney+ or Hulu. Overall I am very happy with this FIrestick and hae purchased one for each of my TVs.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2022
author: Aly B

review_text: Up until the last 6 months I have used my phones hotspot to power my Roku TLC 50" TV.It seemed like most of the time it was a hassle getting my Roku remote to connect with the hotspot and this resulted in buffering and poor resolution. (unless it was in non peak viewing times).Recently i decided to get the Firestick 4k and I don't know what happened but when I installed it on my TLC it greatly improved my reception with very little buffering no mattter when I used it. Very happy with the Firestick 4k.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2022
author: Man o 'tides

review_text: My cube died, and Amazon blocked my return for credit, so I decided to try the cheaper option. The cube had some usability issues, so why not? The stick has proven to be far superior. With the microphone on the remote, it understands commands much better, with the downside of that being you must have the remote in your hand to use voice commands. The interface is fabulous and now I can see where I left off on many streaming services. Can create multiple profiles for Fire, which is versatile across multiple services. Switching between services is quick . Love it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021
author: Kindle Customer

review_title: This has been a pleasant replacement for my old Fire TV stick
review_text: When our old bedroom Fire stick was requiring restart after restart I decided to bite the bullet and order a new device. As always, it arrived on time and was a breeze to set up.What I really like about this new device is that I can control the volume of my soundbar with the Fire Stick remote. No more searching for the soundbar remote when it needs a tweak up or down. I don't really use the app buttons too often. Honestly, they aren't very efficient and it'd not that hard to select one of those apps from the Home screen.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2022
author: Jogster Heisenmeisel

review_title: Plugged my Fire Stick into my… Fire TV.
review_text: I have an Insignia Fire TV that is lackluster to say the least. It’s slow, the remote is shoddy, Alexa integration is poor, there’s nearly no memory, nearly no storage (due to so, so much bloat). I restored it to factory defaults, logged out of Amazon on it, and set up this Fire Stick. It works as a TV remote for my Fire TV, and didn’t have any wonky effects as I thought there might be.Absolutely a night and day difference.Still a lot of bloat. Still a lot of ads. It’s not perfect, but it’s got over double the storage, and enough RAM to run a VPN, Kodi, and an IPTV, which is all I really use it for. If you use traditional streaming services (e.g. Netflix, Hulu, Prime Video, etc.) you’ll be enthused. Hoping this lasts for a long time.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2022
author: Jack

review_title: Love this for use in hotels, out of town, etc.
review_text: I hate hotel tv. No on demand, just live tv. You turn it on and you're in the middle of anything. A short time ago I phoned a hotel to ask if we could use our Apple tv. Nope, but the Amazon fire stick will work. Learned this night before arrival/hotel. We would have ordered direct from Amazon but not enough time. Hubby went to Best Buy and bought one. It worked! Was able upload our most used apps. Look forward to Amazon providing more. My only regret is that we didn't purchase one sooner.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2022
author: Carole

review_title: A product that does not relate as programmed
review_text: I started prime video with a lite fire stick and recently purchased two others, one for the current TV because I believed it would be a better experience and the other for a LG plasma TV I am about to add to my service.I went into the prime philosophy slowly and realize the complicated way these products can relate but did not for me.I Have all three registered thru amazon and could not get the system to recognize me.After one hour I sought out help but the phone service was no longer an option and the bot help couldnt adapt and by that time I began to feel too sick to continue due to elder health issues.I hope to get this straightened out and in no means intend insult just not everyone can do the same thing.There were other help pages but were not visible on my computer to continue with the prompt.,because I couldn't see it even though I almost removed the dock.I reverts back to the lite stick.,and after about 15 minutes I was reconnected, so it is this product.Thankyou
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2021
author: Rita Hadeler

review_title: An Essential to Cut the Cable!
review_text: Have both this device and a popular competitor. There are pluses and minuses to both but overall the Firestick edges out the competition. It's the only one I've found that permits full internet access so you can look up recipes or how-to videos even without your phone and, news flash, it's big enough to be comfortable watching.Would highly recommend for second or third television or video device but treat yourself for the main television and go with the Fire TV. The extra functions are worth it.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2022
author: John R.

review_text: Fire TV Stick 4-K is the best way to stream ... (Period). It's affordable and set up is a breeze. Almost every app is available to support any streaming service you would need. I only wish YouTube TV (Google) and Alexa (Amazon) devices would be better integrated for the end user but with two (2) powerhouse companies ... to each their own.Don't get me wrong, these two work perfectly together. It's a great way to integrate WHAT you watch on TV and WHEN you watch it ... it's an affordable way to "cut the cord" and say good bye to the Cable Companies ... I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2022
author: Mark Ski

review_title: We are so grateful for the Amazon Fire Stick!
review_text: All of our TV's have a Fire Stick We really like the Alexa voice, too! AND I had to connect it by myself for this last one we bought, AND I DID IT! We could not do without this Fire Stick. My husband is 81 years old and he enjoys being able to get so many old movies and TV shows with the free apps that are available. So, go ahead. Try the Amazon Fire Stick with VOICE! It's the best! Just say "Alexa, go to Amazon Prime movies." Or "Alexa, what is today's weather? or, "Alexa, what's the weather in Palm Beach, Florida?" Or Alexa, what time is it? You'll love it!

review_title: Fire Stick with Alexa... What's Not to Love?!

This new Fire Stick with Alexa is on point: it responds so much faster, has included Netflix, Hulu, Prime Video & Disney+ buttons on the bottom for easy navigation. I can tell Alexa what I want to see & it automatically goes to the channel or app & starts the show! I love the Amazon Fire Stick & won't use anything else!

Love the new interface. Amazon listened and it easy way better!!!Bonus: great picture, super fast and great price.So glad I got this newer one to upgrade my current one. review_title: Amazon product but has shortcut buttons for Disney, Hulu, Netflix and Prime
review_text: The Amazon platform has always had one annoying shortcoming - there is no "back" button to bring you right where you were before. Even Roku has that. With the shortcut buttons on this fire Stick remote, this is as close as you can get. I can watch something on Netflick, press the HULU button to schedule something, then press the Netflix button and I'm back, pretty much where I was. It's not perfect, but this is an improvement on the best streaming platform in the business.

review_title: Fire Sticks on All Home TVs
review_text: Am running Fire Sticks on all our home TVs now (5 all together). Switched from expensive Tivo equipment and service to a Silicon Dust HDHomerun unit. Use an antenna for the local stations and can now watch them from any TV or portable device. For streaming we have Amazon Prime offerings, the cheap Hulu, Netflix and Plex. The sticks do everything we want, and the remote with this particular one even operates my old Zenith flat screen, which is really handy, since the original TV remote died. No complaints here.

review_text: We are in the process of making our home a smart home where everything connects and this is an amazing addition. It also has the web, games, and you can connect apple music to it as well. The picture quality is amazing on the TV because we just paid extra for the 4K firestick and it looks beautiful. Do not hesitate to buy this product i promise you will not regret it.

Extra bonus I don't need to use my tv remote because I can control the power and volume from the fire stick remote. I have not had any problems with mine. Works like a charm.

author: A Reader

review_text: I haven’t had a product that blew me out of the water in a long time. I got the 4K version and man let me tell you, this thing is amazing. The setup was so easy and worked seamlessly. They had extra dongles and wires to ensure everything fits. It remembers your prime info and saves you so much time setting up.Parental controls are built in super well and super quick to set up too. It lets you use profiles before you get into the actual streaming which is great when we don’t want our kids even to have access to Netflix or Hulu.The streaming integrations are great as well, gives you way more options than just selecting streaming apps. The Spotify integration is AMAZING.By far the BEST part is the fact that it set up volume with a sound bar about as seamless as possible and it can turn on and off your tv! This $35 item is a universal streaming machine and it doesn’t even need a sensor to work! Definitely my favorite Amazon product to this day. Great work guys, pretty much thought of everything and executed it so well!

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2022
author: Rebecca Sanchez

review_title: Does what we need with no monthly fee.
review_text: The Fire Stick system, combined with a Fire TV Recast, has allowed us to finally cut the very expensive cable TV cord. We still have almost every channel in which we are interested available (plus many new ones), and the Recast gives us DVR service (which we got very used to. The sticks are also very handy when traveling or visiting family: connect to wifi and you get all the (television) comforts of home.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2022
author: K. Hunter

review_text: I was given a used firestick and was disappointed with it's performance. Always buffering (never during commercials). I went to local Best Buy to discuss. New router ($$$) or new Firestick ($)? Thankfully I chose the cheaper option. New one works great with existing provider modem/router. Now it's a matter of finding the most usable apps to satisfy our viewing needs.Unsure what issue is/was with older firestick but very satisfied with the performance of this one. So far, so good.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2022
author: Snickers

review_title: Much better than the integrated streaming app that came with my Smart TV
review_text: I tried the integrated streaming app on my new Smart TV for 6 months and got very frustrated with it. I switched over to the Fire Stick and was happy with it nearly immediately. I was also glad the remote was updated to include short cut buttons for Amazon Prime Video, Netflix, Disney+ and Hulu. I also use the xfinity beta app to access my xfinity subscription so I can avoid getting another cable box that xfinity charges a monthly fee for. Very easy to set up.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2022
author: Michael J Raef

review_text: My old Fire Stick finally gave out. I really like this new version. It’s noticeably faster and the Power button and Volume buttons that control your tv eliminate the need for 2 remotes. The shortcut buttons to the most common streaming services is also a welcomed addition. The setup process was a snap. A real upgrade. I use this rather than the tv’s built in smart features as it supports more streaming services and has a better interface.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2022
author: mac1975

review_title: Good perks - not for data limited use
review_text: I really love all the capabilities this has. Games, movies, TV shows, all of it. What I didn't realize was how much data it would use. Checking the data monitor, the apps hardly use anything, but the firestick itself is using upwards of 75GB a week. Use turned off all push notifications, autopsy ads, and even reduced the playback quality to try to save some data usage, but it doesn't seem to help. I really love this, but I can't even watch one movie a night before reaching my data limit in the first 2 weeks, and I have 200gb of data through my phone company. (I live in a rural area so my options for internet are slim to none). It does what it's supposed to, but itsba data hog.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
author: Monica

review_title: I Really Like the Fire Stick
review_text: I have a few Fire Sticks. I live over seas, and this device really lets me keep up with shows, movies, sports, and news from the US easily. It's a game changer! The fact that a Fire Stick can make any normal television into a smart tv is the best! Why buy a few thousand dollar TV when you can buy a Fire Stick that can do just about all the things a smart TV can.
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2022
author: DanO

review_title: Works great for a cheap solution. Awful interface.
review_text: Firestick's been around awhile, and it does stream well with great quality. The interface change Amazon made a year or two back is not as good as the interface used when the Firestick was first introduced. It lags horribly on all the sticks we have (4 of them), including this 4K stick, which is the most current. Interface is very clunky and poorly layed out. Also, no matter what settings I use, I can't keep it from going into 'Sleep' mode - even when setting the screensaver to 'Never'. It sure knows how to make sure it's advertisements run smoothly, though - even as the rest of the interface lags horribly and the app content SLOWly populates. Caveat Emptor on that, because it's cheap and easy.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022
author: Joe Fortunato

review_title: Definite improvement over the older models
review_text: Way easier to use, and way more options than the old models. Doesn't have to be "re-set" nearly as often. Worth the upgrade.My only thought was the original was designed to be sleek and simple, but each iteration adds more buttons and features. It won't be long until this as complex as every other remote device. I hope they can resist the urge, and keep it sleek and simple "AND" easy to use!

author: John

review_text: Bottom line: The picture quality is great, the new remote and Alexa integration is almost seamless (it doesn’t like raspier voices). However the WiFi issues/ram still don’t allow the device to function consistently and sometimes not at all. When it works it’s great lolTo be clear the fire stick is my favorite device despite its issues, but I often reconsider this when the buffering issues still continue in every generation. This one is only a week old and it still happens.The reasons I know it’s the fire stick itself:Multiple devices in this house running at the same time to include 2 Rokus and an Apple TV and none have this issue at all—also to include the 6 computers used at the same time. None of the game 4 game systems lag either. I can literally use this side by side with the Roku and the fire stick will buffer and the Roku won’t and it doesn’t matter how many people are on the network at that time.The house is made up of IT contractors and gamers, we can’t function without a certain level of internet quality. You would have to move an entire office of computers into this home to max out the bandwidth.The isp is not throttling. It only occurs on the fire sticks in the house nothing else and it’s never during peak times.This issue occurs no matter what internet or house I use the fire stick in.You’d think by now the issue would resolve by this generation but unfortunately it hasn’t.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2021

author: Stephen J Key, Author of ‘Fate Stalks a Hero’ series and ‘The Saga of Heracles Penoit’

review_text: Generally speaking, I love Amazon Firesticks and have used them for years on both my TVs. Recently, both first generation firesticks stopped working after a software update. There were trade-in offers on amazon.com so I traded in both, one for a regular Firestick and another for the 4K version (hoping it would still be useful if I upgraded my TV). The regular Firestick works well but the 4K version shows error messages on both TVs (HDCP error). Apparently (upon web searches for this) it seems older TVs are not licensed to display 4K content due to the new HDCP Regulations. So even though my TVs are 720p and 1080p the signal doesn’t work and I had to return the 4K stick (losing my trade in discount in the process) and will have to wait to get it when I have a new TV.3 stars only because of the compatibility issue with older TVs but I am sure on a new TV this would be a 5 star device.

author: Turbo21

review_title: Moved from Android TV box to Fire Stick
review_text: After spending the last 4-5 years on Android TV boxes (with mixed results), I finally broke down and tried the Fire Stick 4K. I'll not look back! I found the Fire Stick to be much more responsive to program launches, and incorporated "live guide" adds a nice touch when coupled with Pluto TV and YouTube TV. We were also able to install the Android apps that we had become accustomed to using on the TV box, and they ran flawlessly. The only hitch was the ability to use a mouse. After installing Mouse Toggle to allow for mouse clicks on some of the respective programs, all was well. Plenty of storage space if you're a streamer and not a downloader, plenty of 5GHz wifi speed (Speed test ~500Mbps), and plenty of power to run the apps we use.I saw several reviews that said there were delays or 'hang ups' while opening applications, but I didn't find that problem. We use Netflix and YouTube TV extensively, as well as Pluto TV and some of our 'unmentioned' streaming apps--not a single issue encountered after a week of heavy use. The ability to incorporate my Samsung TV, Samsung sound bar, and Fire Stick all in a single remote without having to 'learn' or punch in random codes is amazing. It also fits cleanly behind the TV, so there's one less electronic 'box' on top of the cabinet under the TV! Win-win!I will be purchasing more of these to replace the half-dozen TV boxes in our house, as these are too easy to use! The 5GHz wifi makes a HUGE difference over the current 2.4GHz TV box speeds. I have some that have failed wifi, so they have to be hard wired--no good! So these will soon be the 'thing' in our house for our streaming lifestyle!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2022
author: Aaron H.

review_text: I have been using Fire sticks to stream for a long time now- I think this is my 5th one. Each version has improved on the prior. I love the added buttons for Prime, Hulu, and Netflix, it makes navigating that much simpler. As I continue to upgrade my tv's from HDTV to 4k, I will upgrade my Fire sticks as well.

author: Gregory L Hollon

review_title: (Edited) Not ready for prime time - - Alexa on strike
review_text: UPDATE 1/16/2022I contacted Amazon customer service about replacing this unit. Before I completed the transaction I decided to try the voice control, which had not worked even with tech support sharing my screen. To my great surprise Alexa is now working. I can only guess that another update remedy the problem. The rest of my review stands as is.I bought the 4K Firestick with Alexa as a Christmas season deal direct from Amazon. As a streaming device this fire stick is acceptable.Pros: It was easy to set up, including integration with my VPN and connectivity to my wifi. Channel selection is very good and streaming is smooth and consistent despite my remote location.Cons:1. The interface, compared with my Roku 3, is a little awkward. Some of that may be due to my not being used to the particular design of the interface. But trying to look at all my installed apps or to even tell which ones are installed and which ones are available is a little clumsy.2. *** Poor history tracking: it does not allow me to return where I left off very well. For instance, I was watching Eureka on Amazon Prime, first season. The title pops up correctly in my recently watched row, but every time I click to play, the interface reverts to season 5 episode 1, and I have to drill down to Seasons... Episodes... figure out which episode I had left off at and select it.3. The screen timeout is abominably short. Every time I go to the bathroom or fix some tea, the screen goes to screensaver and I have to click through and say who's watching the fire stick and go to the channel I was watching and locate the episode. It's a little annoying.4. *** Alexa voice control from the Fire stick remote does not work. I get various error messages on the screen anytime I press the microphone button, all while the screen is telling me different suggestions for using Alexa. I have worked with tech support; they were very accommodating. They have shared my screen. We have updated my fire stick software. We have pressed all combination of different buttons at the same time and restarted the base; I've removed batteries from the remote, all to no avail. I have no voice control on my Alexa Firestick.The Firestick has a lot to recommend it, but this version is not ready for prime time.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022

author: Kimberly Mayfield

review_text: It suffers from continuous audio dropouts when plugged into a receiver. I had to fuss with it for over an hour before I finally got it to a state where it wouldn't do it. What I found was that the dropouts occur when the sound is set to either "Auto" or "Dolby Digital Plus," and setting it to "Dolby Digital" seems to have fixed the issue (setting it to stereo also worked, but... gross). From my searching on the internet, this seems to be a problem inherent to the device itself, and not something that can or will be fixed with a firmware update (thanks, Amazon!).I've had one plugged directly into a different TV for a while with no issue. I'm thinking that Amazon is just kind of playing the odds that most people won't be using a receiver, so fixing the issue isn't worth the time/money. I mean, if 95% of your user base is happy, who cares about the other 5%, right?

review_title: Works very poorly in conjunction HUGHES Satellite internet
review_text: I am a recent subscriber to Hughes Net Satellite internet. So I was looking forward to using Amazons Firestick for weekend entertainment opportunities. The firestick installed and updated flawlessly. So I went to watch a movie, nothing but buffering and a message stating that there was no internet connection or that it was very slow. I did all the tests and it was showing that it works perfectly, until you try watching a movie or live TV and then it once again displays slow or not connected to the internet. I contacted Hughes Net. The service support tried a couple of tricks but to no avail. I then got onto Hughes public forum and started reading how many people were experiencing the exact same problem. It appears Hughes Net does not tell anyone that you can't stream TV or Movies over there system as I later found out from some unnamed satellite guru who calmly berated me on , "how stupid I was for trying to use a firestick with Hughes Net, I should have known better" Well now I'm locked into a 1 year deal and a firestick that I can't use.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2021

review_text: I dropped cable a long time back. Got tired of paying for program packages to get a particular channel while paying for channels I had no interest in. I received a Firestick for Christmas for my TV upstairs, but soon realized the Firestick would give me more than what my Smart TV downstairs would offer. It just seems the Firestick allows me to pick and choose, and guide my way to things I wanted to watch with much more ease. My Firestick allows me to select 2.4GHz and 5GHz. No problems with streaming. The only thing I haven't done is integrate "Alexa" or "Dot" to the Firestick, mainly because Alexa is kept in a different room where I would have to holler out what app I want to watch. I have done it and it will work just fine.My only complaint is that I would love to see a feature to bring up a browser (since I do like to browse sites with Keto recipes ((Pintrest and other such sites)). If that ever does happen, let it not be Microsoft or Chrome.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2022

review_title: New Firestick keeps losing control of TV volume settings
review_text: I have tried at least 4 times and the new Firestick keeps losing the settings.I have a Samsung 82: QLED TV and a Panasonic Home Theater system w/Blu-Ray – SC-BTT490 that I have used for years. I recently bought the newest, available Firestick to control all devices and Netflix, Hulu, HBO Max, etc.After struggling to get the Firestick to recognize the Panasonic Home Theater system, it finally recognizes it and turns it on and off with the TV. The Firestick volume control works too with the Home Theater speakers. Then in several days, the Firestick forgets the Panasonic Home Theater system and renders volume to just the TV.This has happened to me at least 4 times in the past several weeks.IT WORKS FOR SEVERAL DAYS AND THEN THE FIRESTICK FORGETS THE HOME THEATER SETTINGSI cannot find out how to correct this problem so the Firestick stays controlling the TV volume as played through the Panasonic Home Theater system of speakers.

review_title: Quality on the fire sticks has degraded
review_text: I bought this as a replacement to another fire stick that had started having issues with its remote. It wouldn't recognize the remote and the remote was burning through the batteries. This fire stick almost immediately started having the same issues. We replaced batteries and we ran through the recommended tech support. Any fixes only lasted a little while. Yesterday, the remote stopped working altogether. The fire stick was right about 30 days old from delivery date so I requested a replacement through Amazon support (a circuitous painful process). Amazon customer support refused unless I went through tech support again first. I could however get a refund (?) and so I did. I'm going back to Roku.

review_text: I recently purchased this item with the expectation that with a trade-in of an old device I would receive a 20% discount which would be applied during checkout. That did not happen Amazon! I did not receive a 20% discount during checkout! I did receive a whopping $3 bucks for my old firestick + charger + USB cable + voice remote. I deregistered the old firestick then the morning of the next day I dropped off my old firestick at the location suggested thinking maybe, just maybe I'll receive the 20% discount once they have the old device. I received a confirmation email from Amazon saying my trade-in has been received and processed. But Nope! Still No 20% Discount! I then called so called customer support after acquiring the # via google. They were of no help. They actually suggested I purchase another one so I put one in my cart and started the purchase process and the 20% discount was applied to that one. Nowhere did I see where you had to turn in the trade-in device first then receive confirmation for it before purchasing the new firestick! Very disappointed with this Amazon trick
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021
