review_text: Hard to express given the questions provided.I don't use Alexa, so that answer is N/A, but N/A is not applicable because it's not a choice - funny but not funny who designs these "survey" type questions? If I had limitations I might use Alexa - but not so far.Yes the 4K Firestick does a good job turning on the TV and controlling the volume; however, my expectations were really low. Picture quality depends upon 1.) TV's quality and 2.) the signal's quality - I can't judge either. Everyone sells "the best" TV and "the best" signal. I can't even say if I have it installed on the best TV I own.I'm judging the 4K Firestick with my $$ - I just ordered 2 more of them. That's the best recommendtion I can give. Maybe its not the greatest Firestick but I see actual improvements.Honesty's the best policy.

review_text: This is my third Firestick.My first I bought to upgrade an existing TV (not a SmartTV) for my various streaming activities.I quickly bought 2 more for different TVs. I am considering getting another for my SmartTV as it's much faster with the various apps than the native ones.Pros: Upgrades a dumb TV to a SmartTV with very little effort. Additionally, with the Alexa integration, I can use voice commands to easily find content on my streaming services. Downloading new apps is easy and quick. Additionally, this voice control works with my Ring Cameras and I can quickly view various camera views using voice commands. I love this feature! Much quicker than using the Ring phone app. The remote is very intuitive and responsive, using BT in lieu of IR so it works without aiming it at the TV. I prefer the Firestick remote over my TV remotes as it is very well designed and works better.Cons: With a Vizio TV, the Firestick remote 'Power' does not work, instead pressing the 'Home' button for 5 seconds usually turns it on. But not consistently and may require using the Vizio remote to turn on. Otherwise all other functions work with the Firestick remote. Occasionally, with the Vizio TV, the Firestick will stop streaming and show a 'loading' icon. This requires a hard reboot (disconnect the Firestick and power supply to it) before it starts working again. Both of these issues seem to be only with my Vizio TV.One mixed pro/con. When purchasing an additional Firestick, it will come with your profile pre-loaded with your profile/ internet PW. This makes adding a new one much faster to your network. You will still need to download various streaming apps that you may have.Clearly though, this could create problems with security and/or if purchasing as a gift for someone else.

author: LUIS ALVARADO JR.

review_title: Causes interference on the HDMI Bus
review_text: I purchased this 4K Fire TV device along with an Ethernet adapter, since I have a network switch under my TV that has a direct connection to my router. This way I don't have the rely on wifi for HD reception. I hooked every up and it all seemed to be working fine on one of my spare HDMI ports on my Sony TV. As the days went by I started noticing that watching various movies from my Home screen, on Netflix, Prime Video, and Hulu, that I would get audio drop outs on my Sonos Beam Soundbar. When this would happen, I would back up the movie to see if the problem was with the movie, but it never was. It was getting so bad, that I also lost my surround speakers and they would come and go intermitently. I contacted Sonos, who has a very good support staff. After a couple of calls and sending them diagnostic codes, they told me that there was noise on the HDMI Bus and asked what other devices were plugged in. The only two devices were my Sony Blu-Ray player and the newly introduced Fire TV. Since I have the Blu-Ray player plugged in for over two years, I removed the Fire TV. Right away, I notice a difference. My surrounds came back and worked well, and as the evenings went by, I noticed that I stopped getting the audio drop outs. Actually, the Fire TV is only a platform to load and install apps that you have to pay for anyway. It's like my old Roku box which I removed a while back when Sony told me that I would need a CEC-less adapter for Roku. So, now it's less than one month and I don't know what to do. I placed everything back in their original boxes and may give Amazon a call tomorrow. Otherwise, I may just hold on to the two devices and see if anyone else wants them.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2022
author: John G

author: Charles R. Tetlock Jr.

review_title: Nice addition to our Vizio Smart TV 2017 model D32
review_text: We like this Firestick, and the operation of it. My only complaint is lack of instructions. Apparently it is assumed you have a newer TV, but nothing for setting this up on older smart tv's such as we have, which is a 2017 Vizion model D32 with HDMI port.Took me about half hour to finally figure out how to get the Firestick and our HDMI to find each other. I finally realized with our TV, you have to set your input...in this case input was HDMI...but for some reason it synced up with HDMI2 connection. I didn't understand it, but it is working well, after I figured out why I was seeing nothing about Firestick.In any case, after it did a software update, and finally booted up, worked well. Takes some time to find your way around and navigate, but this is a very clever nice addition to any Smart TV, especially older ones. I unplug the Firestick every night before we stop watching TV, you don't have too, but we do.A lot to watch that is included with Prime, as well as a lot through IMDBTv that has ads, but still a good selection of shows. The ads on IMDBTv are not too intrusive or long, it is just nice to be able to catch some shows we like and older shows.If you have a newer smart TV, I am sure it is easier to setup, but do not expect to be presented with many instructions, what you get is ok, but no addressing older TV's or any models in particular. You are on your own with that, but the instructions themselves are ok...just not any help for connecting to various TV's.Nice unit, worth the 29.99 we paid for it, and we love Prime too!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2021
author: Jim

review_title: easy to install--just plug in to back of tv
review_text: My Vizio smart tv came with many apps to choose from. Some free, some to subscribe to. I needed the fire stick or something like it to be able to order an app that contain all the shows my husband likes to watch. This particular app had 60 different tv stations or movie apps you could watch with a fire stick. Plugged it in, handed the remote that came with it to my husband and told him to push the little blue button and tell it what he wanted to watch. He did, and bravo, there it was. Motor Trend, his favorite show. Both of us are tech challenged, he more so than I, but you don't really have to be tech smart to install this. Love it and love the remote and love Alexa. Should you have a place to plug in one of these on your tv, you need to order one. By the way. We are both Senior, Senior Citizens, like for a long time. A child could do this. By canceling our cable service which had gotten very expensive and purchasing the fire stick so we could use this app has saved us $100 a month.

review_title: The remote becomes a TV and Fire stick control device.
review_text: This is my fourth Amazon stick purchase. The first two are for my two old TV and they work just fine for that era technology. The third stick is a 4K Fire Stick for one of the 4K Tv's that I have. I was happily impressed with the quality and sharpened of the screen, specially when I installed the Dish network App. The 4K stick allows me to see the dish programing in 4K where the dish reception is not. The only draw back is that not all the features are there and to arrive to an specific accomplishment requires a learning curve to get there. However once the learning process is done it's a pleasure to watch my favorite shows.My fourth Fire 4K stick connected to my last 4K TV created a small issue because the remote control buttons are not located in the same location as my previous stick. So now when I watch TV in the bedroom I have to have a small flashlite to iluminate the buttons otherwise I would be pressing a button that is not giving the result expected. That could be resolved if the buttons had a back light to softly iluminate the button without creating too much of an ilumination. Take note Amazon. The 4K stick is a great device and I completely recommend it to anyone that owns a 4K TV. With a decent internet connection this devise will provide endless amount of TV viewing enjoyment.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2021

review_title: Once it is up and running it is great
review_text: This model seems to have some setup issues, and based on my support searches, im not the only one who encountered this. Initial setup was a nightmare. Even with 500Mbps Internet, the out of box update would hang @ about 85%. I waited 3 hours for it to update before I decided to pull the plug. A restart got me to the same place. After 2 factory resets, the stick finally updated. Once that was done, it was smooth sailing. I'm a fairly technical person, so i cannot imagine what someone with only basic tech knowhow would react to this. I talked to 3 people who returned theirs as defective after encountering this problem. Amazon support was not very helpful They wanted me to change the HDMI port. I tried this on multiple TVs and monitors before and after the first factory reset and the result was the same unresponsive hang. Ive had the stick for about a month now and it is working perfectly. But that initial setup was enough to make me want to go back to my google tv

review_title: Does NOT show cameras like it says it does!
review_text: Took me forever to get ONE of the two of these I bought to even work. And then it would not show the camera feed for my Wyze cameras. My other Firestick I had before I bought 2 of these DID. So I know Wyze is compatible. But I just get a "Sorry, this device does not support cameras"... the main reason I got these was to install on small TVs throughout the upper part of my house so I could use them as a sort of CCTV to keep a watchful eye on my elderly father downstairs. And it doesn't do what it says it is supposed to. And then Amazon wanted to charge me over $30 to return them!!! I am disabled and homebound. In the past, any time I have needed to return something to Amazon, they've sent UPS out to collect it. I've never had to pay any extortionate fees! The customer service rep was just awful, too. Very rude and unfeeling. We have bought SO MUCH from Amazon, especially these last few years BECAUSE (due to our health situation) we are shut-ins. I always felt confident buying from them because the few times we ever had a problem with merchandise, the returns process was accessible to us. Apparently not anymore. Therefore, we will be severely limiting what we buy from Amazon from now on. We are on a tight budget, so we can't shop in a place with the knowledge that they don't stand behind their products if there is an issue, and they make you pay so much to return it, it's untenable.Buyer, be VERY aware!!!

review_text: As a long-time cord cutter, here is my review. I'm comparing to my older Roku(s) here. Going to state up front that I'm in a rural area and my Internet occasionally gets sketchy.Pros: It offers better bandwidth management options, especially for Prime video. This is the main reason I attempted to ditch my Roku(s). (Unless you have a nice router, a Roku will just stream at the best quality it can, regardless of how much bandwidth it is sucking up, especially for Amazon Prime).It's fairly snappy, running circles around my Roku.The Fire TV will pause if you set a sleep timer on your TV. This is great because the Roku would keep right on playing if your TV turned off.All, in all, for the money it is a solid device.Cons: During the occasional storm and other events, my Internet has gone out for a few days or so. When the Internet goes out for the Fire TV, it is pretty close to being relegated to a fishing weight.This isn't totally the Fire TV's fault, but the Plex TV app on Fire can't connect directly to a Plex Server. And even if it did, if there is no Internet, you can't get to a single %#%$#^% app on the Fire TV.I did discover that you can screen cast to it with no Internet, but you know what doesn't work with screen casting to a Fire TV? Amazon Prime (and I'm casting from my phone, which a lot of time still has Internet).The Plex app on Roku will let you use your Plex server even if the Internet is out (for the most part).I have a pretty good investment in my Plex server and have had to keep all of my Rokus on because they work much better with Plex.I was really hoping for a Roku killer and I would be done with the bandwidth sucking devices. Unfortunately, the Fire TV did not allow me to do that, so here I am with two different boxes now.Actually, because I just moved to a cell plan with unlimited Internet, I also have a Chromecast because streaming through my phone works better than my home Internet at the present.To date, I haven't found any Chromecast app on the Fire TV that I like, and even if there was one, it wouldn't work if the Internet goes out...because you can't get to a single app on the Fire TV without an active Internet connection. Like I said, the Internet goes out, it becomes a fishing weight.So here I am with three devices, and the Fire TV gets three stars because of that.------------Update: I did find after searching the Net that there is a way to launch apps on the device if your Internet is out. It's not obvious at all, but it isn't too difficult. On the Roku, you can get to all your apps normally, but they will warn you if there is no Internet. On the Fire TV, you have to dig through a bunch of menus in the settings.So, I came up with a setup I'm happy with. Turned on DLNA on Plex and installed VLC app on FireTv. I haven't fully tested this, but it should work to stream movies to my TV in the event of an Internet outage.Also installed VLC android app on my phone. From the Fire Tv or my phone, VLC was up and streaming movies with just a few button clicks. Now that's the way things are supposed to work. Good job VLC team.

review_text: We love this device. Even though we have a smart TV (we bought this for a different TV), we've been using this as the streaming device due to its complete ease of use and full integration with Alexa and our home security setup. Being able to stream all our favorite services, content from our phones (smart view) and home "cloud drive" (apps may be required, we use Plex) could not be easier. The video and audio quality has been great as well and it responds so quickly, its a dream to use (no, this is not sponsored, LOL). I can walk in the room, tell Alexa to turn on the tv and launch a show/movie/service, ask her to view the front door ring cam, etc... AND, I can pair Bluetooth devices, like headphones, with it so I can listen without disturbing someone who may be sleeping nearby. Cannot be happier with this.

review_title: ZERO buffering since upgrading to the 4K stick
review_text: I owned the regular fire stick for years and would constantly encounter buffering/crashing/freezing issues (most notably while using Hulu). It would constantly lose connectivity despite the TV being less than 6 feet away from my router and none of my other devices using Wi-Fi were being affected or otherwise losing their signals. It would also get VERY hot after just an hour or two. Same issues would occur on a different fire stick at my parents’ house with a similar proximity to the router. No amount of problem solving, cache/data clearing, or uninstalling & reinstalling was helping, so I figured I’d order the 4K stick when it was on sale to see if a next-gen device would still have the same problems even though I don’t have a 4K tv (but I do like the Amazon interface and Home Screen layout). After two months of usage, I haven’t had a single instance of buffering on any app and not once has it lost connectivity (although it still says my signal strength is just “good” even though the router is literally right beside it). Will update if this changes, but so far, so good.

review_title: can not control bluetooth device with fire stick remote
review_text: This is my 2nd fire stick. I've been impressed with my 2nd gen fire stick but dropping it multiple times has taken its tole (buy a cover). A feature I've enjoyed is controlling the volume and mute, on my blue tooth head sets, via the fire stick remote, but i was sorely disappointed to find the my new "Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device with latest Alexa Voice Remote (includes TV controls), Dolby Vision" does not have this feature. Reading multiple reviews I've noticed many complaints it doesn't control blue tooth speaker either. So my assumption is that it does not control blue tooth devices at all. My older stick has software ver 7.2.7.3 and newer ver fire OS 6.2.8.7 . MAYBE AMAZON COULD DO A SOFTWARE UPDATE!!
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2022
author: Annie

author: Carey E.

review_text: I have recommended the Amazon Firestick to friends and family! We have 4 Amazon Firesticks installed ( one per TV) and an Amazon Recast for local over the air broadcast signals. The Amazon devices have exceeded our expectations! They were easy to install and set up. Any action needed during set up, the Firestick guides you thru. Within minutes, you can stream your favorite programs. WHO NEEDS CABLE TV or the bill from cable TV? Why pay for channels you don’t watch? All you need is a DSL or an ISP internet connection to stream programs thru your Amazon Firestick! When we switched to the Amazon Firestick and Recast, we had every local channel and movie service anyone could ask for. The picture quality is superb, sharp and clear! You can easily search for programs ( just ask Alexa- she will find it). And, there are many extras because you can interface the Alexa function to turn lights on or off, check the front door camera and so on). The Amazon Firestick is versatile, stable and provides a service that is second to none ( it is a number 1 platform for your TV service and household). It is well worth the price. Thank you Amazon for a great product and service!!

review_text: I’m enjoying using it but, all thing’s considered spend the extra $15 or $20 more and buy the Max which has the newer firmware. I’m a geek at heart and in some sick twisted way, I had fun watching a bunch of YouTube videos, setting up a ftp on my laptop, backing up all the apps to it and then formatting the external usb stick transferring all the apps back onto the usb and reloading them as external on the firestick. Went from a gig free to 3.24 free. But it took me half a day. The two things I learned are that some apps don’t behave properly when moved to external memory and when it’s time to update an app that wasn’t written to be on external memory, it won’t update. You have to reinstall it and then uninstall it and move it to the usb again. The new firmware makes this a one click easy transition. And I have the feeling that the older stick will never get the full upgrade to the newer firmware either because of some technical reason OR more likely because - They want to sell you the newer stick.Update - Other reviews complaining about ads and WiFi connection problems, turn off the ads and fix your bad WiFi. The stick can’t do it for you. And Yes the ONN Walmart device is $20 but it’s missing some features.

review_title: So slow if it were faster I’d be so happy

Fling story short that took TWO DAYS because it kept saying the internet quality was too poor but we have an extender specially for this purpose. It finally let me set it up but now only Netflix works and HBO go only sometimes but take forever to load. None of the live channels work which is half the reason we got the fire stick. I’m going to contact support to see if they can help us but right now I feel defeated frustrated and feel that this was not a good purchase. We previously had Roku and thought it’d be an upgrade but right now it feels like a downgrade.

review_title: For those having Remote pairing issues...Overall good product
review_text: Like many reviews here... I had significant issues with getting the remote to pair. It seems to be an issue with the software version on the device being mis-matched with the software on the remote with the Alexa button.I was able to work around this by pairing an existing remote I had for the Firestick with the simple Voice button on top(that also had volume control) - that remote worked almost instantly after pressing the home button for 10 seconds and I was able to complete the setup. I was still unable to add the new remote no matter what I did (would not show up as discoverable)I then had to do a software update on the Fire stick; which then made the NEW remote discoverable but it ALSO required an update before it would finish the setup. Once both the firestick and the new remote were updated, it all finally worked as expected.I'm unaware of a solution if you do not have an older remote to do the initial setup of the fire stick.Otherwise the performance of the device is great. No complaints on features/functionality.

review_title: Helpful to organize and watch all streaming services
review_text: Recently I decided to stop cable TV and limit watching tv to the streaming services I subscribed to. Prior to purchasing this device it was a lot more cumbersome (not difficult) to open and use these services. Now, after signing in once to the services all I have to do is use the built in Alexa to ask it to watch a particular program or type of program (ie: action movies or “Blue Bloods”) and it will open that program. There are also connections to free streaming services included for use with the product. I have not missed my cable TV subscription at all.One thing of note though, you do need to have decent high speed internet to get the best from the product. And I already had both the high speed internet and the subscriptions to the streaming channels, this device has just made it so much simpler to use them.Connection is easy….simple plug in connection and you also need wireless streaming internet.

review_text: I like the firestick since it is easy to use, it literally walks you through setup and in about 15-20 minutes you are up and going. The picture quality is great and the streaming is good as long as you have a good network.One drawback I do not like is the layout. The advertising on home page can be annoying. It does keep what you are in the middle of watching in one of the top rows. I do not like the push for prime shows, it could be layed out better with filters for free shows vs prime, paramount, tubi, free, and so on.On the newer models you have buttons on the bottom for netflix, disney and whatever. I don't use them so I consider them a waste of remote space.I would like to see the remote upgraded to glow buttons, I have seen these on other remotes, if you move the remote the buttons will have a soft light to them so you can see what you are pressing.Walk tall and carry a big stick!

review_title: Lowers the IQ of your TV.
review_text: I honestly think this is the worst of all the streaming devices. It’s always breaking. You always have to restart/refresh/unplug, etc. all the time. I’ve gone through several, but it’s my fault because I keep buying it (Mainly because it’s cheaper than most other devices). I ordered the protection plan for the last purchase & have already had to order a replacement. Get this, the one that they replaced it with is also defective. The annoying part is that if it’s not one thing it’s the other. Now the remote is also broken & It’s not the battery.I have a few smart TVs, but I still like to buy streaming devices for many reasons. I have appleTV on the main TV, Roku on another TV, one bedroom has an old AppleTV, Roku in another bedroom, & FireStick in my bedroom. I figured I’d save $$ by getting the FireStick. Well… bad idea. Either every one that I get is defective or they’re all just junky. BTW - my bedroom TV is also the only TV that isn’t a smart TV. The FireStick doesn’t add to its IQ, either. Oh well, I guess I’ll buy another ROKU.

review_title: Excelente equipo funciona perfectamente en Perú.
review_text: Ya teníamos en casa el Fire TV Stick Lite y estabamos bastante contentos con el producto. Decidimos comprar Fire TV Stick 4K debido a la resolución máxima además que incluia los controles para la TV, los cuales funcionan excelente! Es muy practico manejar el TV y el Fire TV Stick desde un solo control. Es compatible con muchas marcas y modelos de TV, incluso con marcas que no se enlistan en el equipo. Para que el equipo funcione sin problemas es necesario configurar su ubicación mediante la app Amazon Alexa, se vincula al dispositivo y se configura la región. 100% recomendado!

review_text: Was nervous as to what to expect switching to streaming instead of cable. Realized my tv was not a smart tv the fire stick is so simple to use. Literally just plug in into the tv and wall outlet and start watching tv. Only thing I did not realize when ordering is that the fire stick has to be plugged into a wall outlet as well as the tv no big deal but just know it will not work without it. Super user friendly my husband isn’t great with technology but he’s figured it out so I have faith anyone can. My only suggestion would be to by a bright remote control case/cover because these fire stick remotes are tiny and black and VERY easy to lose. All in all definitely worth the money - the apps you can get are limitless and the streaming is so easy. Picture quality/ streaming quality is great I cannot tell any difference in it and the DIRECTV we used to have.

review_text: My fire tv stick got stuck on the logo screen after automatic update routine.Amazon customer support said they are aware of the problem and trying to fix it on their end. They don’t deny that fact but still will not replace with a new unit and I now have a brick with no support.Amazon do not stand behind their own products the way they used to and I’m only getting an overseas support with bad english and robotic behavior.I am canceling my years long prime membership and getting my content elsewhere.Shame on you Amazon.

review_text: My first Firestick stopped working (after the remote did, and I was never able to revive the remote and resorted to the excellent smart phone app remote). It is connected via a dongle to my small monitor that I keep in the kitchen and transport to my sewing room.After purchasing this as a replacement, it occurred to me that the problem may have been with the dongle, and sure enough that was the case. I now have 2 firesticks, but I'm happy with that. I can keep one connected to my large TV, and enjoy using one with my traveling monitor.Although my cable company has the apps on the TV, the picture quality through the firestick is superb v. the one coming through the cable. I'm sure there is reason for it, which is above my pay grade--so I'm glad to enjoy this convenience for a modest cost relative to my use.

review_title: Time to dump cable or satelite TV? This IS THE solution we should have used several years ago!
review_text: Note that we are not currently using the Alexa integration.Going from satelite or cable TV is a daunting prospect: will I find local channels and my cable/satelite favs? Yes, you will, and this makes it pretty easy to make the transition.Oh, and really cost effective. The one-time cost for the purchase of 5 Fire Sticks is less than our monthly satelite service. And we get more interesting content.We have transitioned all 5 of our home based TV's.Yes, there is a bit of a learning curve and installation takes about 20-30 minutes per set. In our case, we lost 2 non-local PBS stations, but all thing considered: so worth making the change.And if you have an RV, this is a must. No more satelite dish to haul and install, no more lousy cable service, or lack of over-the-air service in remote areas.

author: Guillermo Esparza Jr

review_text: Flaw #1 you can only connect one set of headphones or one audio source via bluetooth. However, you can connect your bluetooth headset and bluetooth keyboard simultaneously. A keyboard will come in handy if you have to type in searches or passwords or profile stuff. Oh, and guess what? You won't find anything in the directions about anything related to bluetooth or even on the box. But if you fiddle with the onscreen setting you will run across it.Flaw#2: The directions suckIf your remote doesn't pair with your TV correctly at first just remove your TV and redo the pairing.You can download and install APPS so you can watch movies and TV and you can uninstall them as well. So, if you're not familiar with this, you can download HBO max or Showtime Max and sign up for a monthly subscription without having a cable TV service. There are many free TV apps etc but you will have to deal with ads. ROKU has free TV and movies but you will have to watch a few ads maybe twice during a 45 minute episode of your fav TV show. If you have Amazon prime you may be ad free. I don't know. I don't want to pay for anything or watch ads but I'm dealing with it for now.Flaw#3: The firestick remembers I have headphones paired but when I turn on the device I have to physically go into settings and connect them but sometimes I don't and it will connect them automatically when I turn the headphones on. If I forget to connect my headphones at startup and I go into an APP and start watching a show. I have to go back to the home screen and go into setting and connect my headphones. Then I have to go find the app I was using and go back to my show. The stick doesn't have a recently viewed section that actually works. The problem is there are so many apps that I sometimes forget which app I went into to watch that show. You can however ask Alexa to just play the episode of whatever you were watching if you can remember what you were watching. I feel like this function of continuing watching the show you were watching could be better. You know how everybody likes to binge watch but at some point you have to turn off the TV, right? When you go back the next day there should be a section box that you can click on that shows you what show you were on last and allow you to go right to it. There is a recently viewed section that doesn't really show you what you recently viewed. I call that useless.you have to have good data speeds otherwise you'll never see 4k. I have hotspot on my phone but the data speeds in my area suck most of the time. But I'm paying too much for cell service to buy home internet that isn't much better.Just so you know, this firestick will stay connected to your wifi even when powered off and it will automatically connect when disconnected no matter what. So, when I turn on my phone hotspot the firestick will jump right on and so will my Vizio TV and so will my Laptop. I have to go in my phone and limit my devices so be forwarned.and that's all I know for now
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022
author: George

review_text: This is my fourth fire stick. These devices are inexpensive but high quality. The later generations have consistently gotten faster. The user interface is good. The voice recognition works very well. One of the best features is that the remote can learn the commands for turning your tv on and off and for adjusting the volume. This very simple remote can replace your tv remote for most viewing applications. The remote can also learn the volume commands for a sound bar, but I still need the sound bar remote to turn that off. The preprogrammed streaming service buttons are very convenient and work well. I do watch prime video, but also Hulu, Netflix and other services. This streaming device is equally effective for all of these services bi continue to be very happy with this device.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2022
author: Martin

review_title: New 4K Fire stick is a huge improvement over the original.
review_text: I purchased my original Fire stick from Amazon around 2018 for my then eight year old Samsung HD tv. It worked well but would often freeze up on me, requiring a re-boot. I purchased the 4K Fire stick and it arrived a couple of days before super bowl Sunday. I noticed a huge improvement immediately. It loads content faster and it brought back the super sharp picture on my now 12 year old 55” Samsung HD tv. The new remote has easy to use controls, including Alexa. The best new feature is the ability to sync the Fire remote with my 10 year old Yamaha sound bar, which allows me to control the volume directly from the Fire tv remote. Another great feature is the Bluetooth connectivity. I can now pair my Bluetooth headphones with the Fire stick and watch tv at night without disturbing my wife. Amazon did a great job on the upgrade. Buy yours today.

author: Darren Washington

review_text: To get Dolby Atmos the Firestick has to be plugged directly into my Samsung HW Q700A sound bar, and not into my TV set and then the TV to the soundbar. With this arrangement of hardware, then the approach to get Atmos varies with the service. So for HBOmax, if it is going to work for a selected item, Dolby Atmos is automatic. With Apple TV+ it is not going to work at all. And for Prime Video, you have to start watching, select the Options icon, scroll to Audio, and then click on Dolby Atmos (in the rare event it is available). (By the way, Apple TV reciprocates: it won’t supply Atmos for Prime Video items, just like Firestick won’t do it for Apple items.)I’d add to this that with my sound bar, Atmos makes very little difference. I know it is present because the sound bar displays Dolby Atmos when it is delivered. Maybe if I added the optional rear speakers??
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2021
author: Advisor

review_text: I have several Fire devices and following the failure of a remote for my FireTV, I decided to upgrade my first stick to a 4K device rather than simply buying a replacement remote. There is a noticeable improvement in picture quality and the user interfaces have been upgraded.However, despite only owning the device for a few months, it's already frozen several times, requiring me to unplug the unit to reset it. Further, it no longer goes to sleep by holding the home button. If this is happening within the first few months then I am afraid how this device will perform in the next year or two.Also, the remote also doesn't feel as sturdy as prior remotes and the battery cover doesn't lock as securely into place. I am hopeful that it will last.It is convenient for streaming but given this device has existed through several generations I would have expected better performance and fewer quirks this early in ownership.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022
author: Michael R. Ferguson

review_text: As a long time apple tv 2 user I really liked its small remote. When more and more streaming apps started to be discontinued on the apple tv we moved to using the PS4 as our streaming device. The cumbersome remote/controller of that brought us to getting an FireTV stick which costs as much as a PS4 TV remote and I must say I wish I had done that years earlier. It has a small remote, supports all channels and most important, can manage volume and other features of your TV or receiver as well. Now we just have 1 compact remote to manage everything. Both audio and video look are great even though I still have an old 1080 HD tv.

author: Amazon Customer

review_text: Out of the gate we love fire sticks. Have them on every TV. The consolidated streaming options just work really well for our families needs. BUT it doesn't take long before they are glitchy and/or unresponsive. We inevitably find ourselves having to frequently unplug and reset them, as the stick will randomly and frequently become unresponsive to the remotes. The child's account on the app, while great in theory, is particularly confusing for them when tv shows appear on their home screen that they can't actually watch because it's tied to a service we don't subscribe to. The fire stick and related app setup needs a TON of work, but thankfully aren't that expensive compared to cable networks and such so for now we continue to buy them and deal with the annoyances.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2022
author: Ashley Coleman

review_text: We recently decided to get rid of our satellite cable after 20 years as we could not justify the monthly bill. Between the two of us, my husband and I watch less than 10 hours of TV a week. We decided to purchase an antenna for local channels and I bought this Firestick 4K streaming device for our bedroom (not smart) TV. A nice bonus was Amazon linked it to my account for easier set-up.Install took minutes with clear instructions and no glitches, or hiccups. The Alexa integration was pretty straightforward and I am getting better using this application. There are tons of content, free and paid to choose from. I am not a fan of the huge ad banner promoting shows but what can you do? The picture and sound are both excellent, it boots up quick, streams seamlessly and meets all my needs.

author: Tr@cie

review_text: This is my first external streaming device, my only other experience being the ROKU built into my TCL TV. I've got to say that this is easier and the quality seems to be every bit as good. Because I had wired Ethernet in the bedroom left over from a previous AT&T UVerse box I used the Amazon wired adapter which took away any worries about wireless coverage. Setup was dead simple and I had it working within minutes with several different streaming sources -- Prime and YouTube being the first. The most time-consuming part was training the remote to work with the Panasonic TV and that only took a couple of minutes of button pressing following the instructions. I don't really use the voice recognition, not being used to it, but the few times I tried it seemed to work fine -- I'm just a button masher at heart.

author: Mary Ann Evans

review_title: All Your Streaming Services in One Place
review_text: I recently got rid of my satellite tv service which I had for 25 years. I started streaming live tv in one of the streaming services which is going to save me hundreds of dollars per year. I had google chrome cast and we were having a hard time adjusting to casting using a phone or tablet, because we were used to using a remote control. I decided to order the Amazon Fire Stick and was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to put all my streaming services in one place including live tv. The remote is great and allows us to quickly shift between streaming services including live tv, especially with the Amazon Prime, Netflix, Disney+, and Hulu buttons included. The voice command feature and ability to pair it wit Alexa voice control is awesome, Highly recommend the fire stick for ease of use of all your streaming services.

review_title: A must have for every television!
review_text: The FireTV (Firestick) has certainly come a long way. The tactile feeling on the remote is perfect, voice commands work well, and the LiveTV button blends seamlessly where I get a feeling that I'm actually a cable subscriber. I love this thing so much, that I doubt I'll ever get a SmartTV, Amazon has come so far with this where SmartTV's UI and experience feel cheap in comparison (Yeah, I know actual TVs exist loaded with this, but I'd likely update the Firestick before I felt I needed a screen update, I feel it's best to keep these things separate/modular).

review_text: The stick drops connections quite a bit. It will tell me home is not available when it drops its connection. I was skeptical of this. When the stick states it does not have a connection, my laptop and phone never lose a connection and work fine.Example from tonight. Started to watch espn+, it dropped the connection. I restarted the stick and it started to work again. At the same time, my laptop never lost a connection. Then it dropped the connection again and exited the espn app. I restarted it and it would not connect or launch the espn app so I just switched to my laptop and watched the game from the browser. My browser has not lost connection yet.I will return to using my laptop to stream. Maybe in a few years they will fix the bugs where this product is worth the hassle.

author: TH

review_title: Doesn't do what I got it for.
review_text: The main reason I got this is to work with the Fire TV Recast, which records over the air broadcasts. The user on the phone app doesn't work with Recast, but this isn't a review of Recast. Fire TV is needed to play the recordings on Recast, but getting to the recordings is nearly impossible. The recordings don't show up on Fire TV, except sometimes randomly. The voice recognition really sucks, I say "DVR Recordings", and 9 times out of 10 it doesn't recognize it as what I said. So I ask "What did I just say?" and it shows "d. v. r. recordings" which is right, but it doesn't actually show DVR recordings. I'm ready to bag the Fire TV and Recast business because they work so poorly. Roku is way better, but doesn't have an Antenna TV DVR option. And in this case, neither does Fire TV.

author: Roger Swearingen

review_title: Good overall, TERRIBLE for viewing IMDB TV
review_text: UPDATE: Overall this is an excellent product with a simple clean remote that is laid out well. Amazon Prime and Netflix apps are great. But viewing IMDB TV programs using the IMDB app is a challenge since the latest update (was better before update). After pausing a program, when you press play, the bottom 1/3rd of the screen is covered by the timeline and large icons for other episodes of the same program you're watching (if it's a TV series). Above that, the middle 1/3rd of the screen is covered by text description and title of currently playing program. THIS GOES ON FOR 12 SECONDS, RUINING THE PLAYBACK OF THE PROGRAM. This is an app issue, and since Amazon owns IMDB they are ultimately responsible for the app. So one star off for that. Recommended with reservations for viewing IMDB TV..

review_text: I've been using an Amazon fire stick for 3 years. I decided to upgrade this year because it had been going very slow since the major update to the interface. I still don't understand why it happened but the audio went waaaaayyy out of sync. I tried troubleshooting, resetting, restarting numerous times, and tried to manually sync the audio in settings and it still didn't work. I talked to the Amazon support team and they sent me a replacement. That did the same thing. I tried my old decide and IT did the same thing! I never had problems with the old one for 3 years. What the heck?Anyway, TLDR; switched to Roku and it works great. The only pro I have for the Fire Stick over the Roku is that the remote is a lot slimmer and lighter, which I prefer.

review_text: Wish I'd done this sooner. I cut the cord on my cable and satellite service and now have more channels to watch than I had before. Streams great on my 5ghz network, no lagging or stuttering so far. Cannot tell a difference between the 4k FTV and the DTV or Xfinity cable. I am very happy I made this decision. There are an incredible amount of free streaming services with a lot of current content. If you want local content then subscribe to a streaming service that will offer your local stations for more than half the price you pay the big cable and sat companies. The 4k fire stick was very easy to install with my AVR on one and also directly to the TV in the other room. All works great, you don't lose anything but gain more $ in the pocket book.

review_title: Controls "all" peripheral hardware - Wish I bought it long ago!
review_text: I am SUPER happy I finally got this, on sale! I did not realize that it would also control the volume on my bose system (I broke the bose remote more than 2 years ago and have been controlling the volume by standing up, kneeling down, and pressing the buttons... like we had to in the 70's - as the remote was over $150, I did not want to replace it) ... but VERY happy that it controls everything... and now I only need that one remote! Turns TV/Audio on and off, and declutters the coffee table (as there is only the need for the Alexa remote) ... Super convenient too that it came set up to my account, and I could turn the outside lights on/off with the Alexa remote too!! Love it and wish that I had bought it a long time ago!

review_text: I don't have much truck with Alexa yet - call me a Luddite. But the thing works, and I've found a few freebies to watch. We ditched cable TV and bought this to access Prime Video and Pluto (ad-supported TV, just like the old days!) and whatever else. So far have not missed cable at all. There are more free movies and YOutubes and stuff than I could watch in a lifetime. I think we bought a $5 sub to KERA the public channel here - wife likes that. BTW I wrapped much of the remote with hockey stick tape - got a free roll from the Internet - to give a better grip on that slippery banana peel of a remote. It's so slipper that it will squirt halfway across the room if there isn't some friction material added to it.

author: Texdance

review_title: Good device, but the remote could be more intuitive
review_text: I have had four of these Fire Sticks prior to this one. Each gets incrementally better. I am not a fan of the remote control layout. For one thing, it is not lighted, so it requires a fair amount of light to see the buttons, which are not especially logical. The ring control is a poor design and having the options in one of nine unmarked buttons is irritating. The listing of other streaming services (besides Prime Video) suggests a payoff. Really, Disney+? Why not Apple+? The home page is a mini-mental status test. It could be better. I actually got yet another Fire Stick because neither Xfinity nor my Sony smart TV has the Apple TV+ app, so I am forced to go through yet another device that I, personally, don't need for other streaming. Kind of irritating.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022
author: drjazz86

review_text: I have many streaming devices, from original Chromecasts, to 4k FireSticks/TV, Roku, PS/Xbox, 4k blu-ray players...etc. I wanted to try this stick to see if the quality was better than my Xbox One X for overall streaming. (as Amazon Music HD is limited on the Xbox app, and I'm running a very high resolution 7.4.4 system) The picture looks good, possibly better than the Xbox1X feed, but the overall audio seems more compressed, and Amazon Music HD seems to not assess the device capability correctly (always 16bit, rather than 24 bit). So without add'l info gathering, I'm going to assume this stick isn't passing audio content in the most efficient manner, or is slightly limiting the throughput - granted, it is a wifi-connection over the ethernet connection (Xbox1X), but it is sitting next to the router, and I have consistent, ~900+mbps wifi throughput.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2021
author: CC

review_text: It does what it’s supposed to do. It’s not that different than my previous one that lasted two years, then just quit. Of course, I already went through ALL the troubleshooting stuff before I called tech and they insisted I go through it all again (or at least act like it). Anyway, when it still didn’t work, they tried to tell me it was my TV. Ummmmm….NO. It wasn’t. They gave me 15% off a new firestick (only after I asked for a discount), so I got this one. It’s OK. I don’t really need the specific buttons at the bottom for Prime, Netflix, Disney, and Hulu. That’s a little redundant and I don’t use Disney or Hulu. AND…..I don’t know WHY they insist on making the battery cover SO hard to get off. I have to put rubber gloves on just to get that thing to slide down. We’ll see how long this one lasts.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2021
author: Jessica K.

review_title: Wasted hours & hours trying to make the remote work.
review_text: Alexa worked, e.g., to “show weather” or “show comedies”, but not to “rewind 1 minute”. Buttons to the left and right of the play/pause button, and the pause/play button itself, did not work. I returned this FireTV for cause, and ordered a replacement FireTV.I had my son (a networking technology & intrusion detection guru) come over to see if he could help with the 2nd FireTV. He set it up, and as I recall it seemed to work ok: the buttons (see above) worked initially, but then they quit working. Alexa worked, e.g., to “show weather” or “show comedies”, but not to “rewind 1 minute”. Disappointed a 2nd time, I’m not sure what to do next.It is noted that the foldout leaflet was printed in a font so small I had to use a magnifying glass to read it -- not good.But now, even though all of the above problems still persist, there is a new development. When I bring the Sling app into play, all of the problems clear up. The rewind and fast forward buttons now work, as does the pause/play button. BUT, only while the Sling app is running.The literature that came with FireTV gave me no inkling that running the Sling app would (just temporarily) clear up anything. Maybe running other apps (e.g., hulu) would do the same. It would be easy to just let the remote function properly from the outset, wouldn't it? Not disclosing that the remote would not work is just wrong of Amazon. Not disclosing that running the Sling app would temporarily make the remote work properly is also wrong of Amazon.I could remark that Amazon deliberately disabled the remote to force users to sit through all of the ads in a misguided attempt to generate ad revenue for their own advantage, instead of simply enabling the full function of the remote as advertised in their own literature.Will update this review as experience warrants.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2022

author: ARD

review_title: 4k on any TV at a great price of $26.61
review_text: On my first order of the fire stick 4k it seemed I got an open box item at first. Most of the items didn't have plastic on them. After plugging it all in I was stuck at syncing the remote. Followed all of the Amazon troubleshoot procedures, to no avail. After trying multiple times threw out the evening into next day, I gave up and contacted Amazon for a replacement. Within 2 days I had another one, that had plastic on every piece it came with. Started right up synced the remote right away and started watching TV in 4k. For $26.61 it is a steal, and way better quality then the older models. I recommend this product if you have a big TV, it is so much cleaner looking. It is even better quality and more responsive then the apps I use to use on the TV itself.

author: appuser

review_text: What am I streaming? Netflix, Hulu, Prime, HBO Max, Apple TV+, Disney+Why did I need it? I was on vacation with family in a rented condo. The tv was not a smart tv. So, I ran to the nearest Best Buy and bought the device. It is my 5th. I know how well the Fire Sticks work and how easy they are to set up.My Experience. I had it connected and streaming Prime Video in less than 5 minutes. It took more time to look up the passwords to the other streaming service than it did to get them streaming. Fast and easy. All you need is good or better wi fi. When the vacation was done, I disconnected everything and took it home until our next vacation. Had I thought ahead, I would have brought a Fire Stick with me.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2021
author: Professor Diabolicus

review_title: Way better than paying for cable !!
review_text: This is totally worth buying. Before our cable used to be 200+ for internet and TV. We switched to only this and roku Tvs not long after they became big. Now the total is only 150 for everything at the most.... internet, plus the subscriptions we have to Netflix, Hulu, Disney, prime, and a few others. They have everything we need plus more. The remote is also great for kids because of the voice option. My 6 year old is learning to spell and read. When she can't spell titles of what she wants to watch, she uses the voice option.. makes life so much easier for us both ! Thats the one thing I love way more about the firestick than roku. Our rokus don't have the voice option on the remotes.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022
author: Ciera McMahon

review_title: Uses up TOO much internet data!!
review_text: The picture clarity and everything else is top notch. My issue, is that even when I’m not using it, it’s eating up all of my monthly allotted internet data.I’ve been receiving alerts from Comcast/Xfinity telling me that I’ve used up 90%, etc., of my data since I’ve been using the Fire stick. This has been happening after only a few days into each month. I’ll have to pay more on my cable bill if I go over my limit.It keeps using up your data even when you aren’t using the fire stick as long as it’s hooked up to the tv. I’ve started unplugging it from the tv now. Just watching one movie uses a lot of data. That’s my only complaint, but it’s a major concern.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021
author: B.

review_text: I already own (2) second generation fire TV sticks, I use these on my (2) 1080 HD TV's. I bought this first 3rd generation FIRE TV stick for (1) of my (3) 4K TV's it was so easy to set up and liked it so well, for the quality and advanced 3rd generation features. I just ordered 2 more for my other 4K TV's. All of my TV's are smart TV's and have streaming too, but these fire sticks really pull in the Wi Fi signal much stronger!! Give your smart TV a break, these fire sticks really pull in signal much better! They optimize for HD and Dolby Vision and Atmos if you have that. If you have an 4K AV receiver you can plug fire sticks directly in to get the sound fields you have in your receiver.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2022
author: Happy Howie

review_text: I think it was pretty straightforward to set up, although I must confess to not having done the set-up myself, thanks to my tech-savvy daughters. The second one we installed on a small kitchen TV did not function initially. My daughter had installed it with the short extension cable, so I unplugged it, removed the extension and plugged it back in and, what do you know, it worked just fine! It's easy to use, and the voice recognition is pretty good, but not perfect; it's certainly helpful most of the time in getting to a different app or programme. The Prime, Netflix, Hulu and Disney specific buttons are also a handy addition. All in all, we are very happy with it's functionality and value for money.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2022
author: Amazon Customer

review_title: Best smartTV stick but needs memory card slot.
review_text: It's really worth your money in terms of price, function and entertainment value above most competition. Unfortunately, as you wander into deeper real of enjoyment you'll be prompted of low storage and deleting other apps. Sadly it will be a brickwall for the more advanced users. I installed Real Racing 3 and it was functional, looks good but only able to finish the training/tutorial race. No more space left to download 1GB of game date to play the real game. There's plenty of juice in this stick to render the game fairly playable. Asphalt 8 racing game runs fine and smooth which is impressive. I hope there's a way to increase storage space. Cheers!
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2022
author: Minhnix

review_text: I decided to add a fire TV stick to my kitchen tv since I do occasionally watch Hulu, etc there. I swapped my existing fire stick to the kitchen and put this new one in my my main TV.I didn’t realize that this stick has shortcut buttons to prime Netflix Disney and Hulu. No more scrolling through multiple apps. There is also a mute button ( I don’t t recall one on my other fire stick) so I don’t have be grabbing my regular remote. There’s also an all tv listing button for IMDB TV.I can’t comment on stream quality other than I haven’t seen any buffering issues with this stick. A little irritation with Alexa integration since I have an Alexa show in the room and if I ask the Alexa something while streaming, the fire stick responds
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2021
author: T. Evans

review_title: If you have 4K TV, you need this upgrade
review_text: This was an upgrade from a 1st gen Fire TV (HDTV) purchased in 2015. We bought a 4K TV a few years back, but I did not upgrade the Fire TV as there was little 4K content available at that time. Well time slipped by and it seemed like the old Fire TV was not doing the job, flesh tones were bad and it seemed to lacking clarity. Well, the new 4K Fire TV Stick fixed all that. (Kicking myself for waiting so long.) The new 3rd gen remote was also worth the upgrade as well. I was using a separate IR remote to manage the sound bar and now the Fire TV manages everything very well. One button on/off, sound up/down/mute and great voice integration. Perhaps the best $30 I have spent this year.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2021
author: Clark K Wallace

review_title: My Fire TV sticks (I purchased 2) are working well.
review_text: I stopped my cable, and I use this product for two TVs in separate rooms of my home. Steam quality is good; voice recognition is good. Integrates well with Alexa. Sometimes too well. What I mean by that is sometimes, I only want input from Alexa, but she goes by way of my Fire TV Stick. In that case, I simply shut off the TV, then I get what I’m looking for.I like the fact that I can watch just about everything I want to watch, when I want to watch it. I can binge watch a program if I want to. I also like the reduced amount of commercials. I greatly enjoy the product and recommend it highly.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022
author: Yvonne Hall

review_title: It is actually really well made
review_text: I got one of the first firesticks and i hated how laggy it was, how it wasnt user friendly. how freezy and slow it was when loading a show, it didnt have many apps, all around was bad. Fast-forward a few years and this thing is amazing, i love it. i have been a loyal roku fan (not the sticks) and got this firestick with an extreme distaste for amazon electronics. I got it for my child because it is youtubekids compatible unlike the roku and they wouldn't mind the freezy laggyness like i would. What i got instead was a no lag, no issue, streaming amazing quality, and user friendly to an adult and a child whos just learning this stuf. I ended up buying a second firestick as a gift for a family member because i liked the firestick so much and the sale price it was so worth it. I would most def recommend this to anyone
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021
author: T.Nix

review_title: Beats the heck out of our Comcast DVR!
review_text: We have a Comcast DVR that also has most of the apps we use available through it. But the performance of the box is so dismally slow that I hate using it! Plus, on the Disney+ app, the remote moves the cursor multiple choices for each press of the selector, making it nearly impossible to select a show. The fire TV eliminates all those issues. All the apps work as expected and the response is immediate. It’s not perfect- it won’t let you default to a stereo output, but will only output sound in the format it’s recorded and it MUST be plugged into the hdmi extension or it won’t work. But beyond the minor quibbles, it’s a great device and I recommend it wholeheartedly!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2022
author: Steve M

review_text: Been an Apple TV user for a long time but my device started flaking out so I decided to switch it up and purchase the fire stick a year ago. It was more cost effective but I was skeptical about it. This thing is sweet! I haven’t found a streaming app that isn’t available to download onto this thing. I was using three remotes before and this consolidated me down to one, which is always nice. I can still get all the Apple TV shows as this also has an Apple TV app which is fantastic. I just purchased a second one for a different tv. This thing was an absolute breeze to set up, and it allowed me to set it up with all the apps I already downloaded onto my first fire stick. They make this so easy and I am impressed. I highly recommend.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2022
author: WW

review_text: Forced by silly setup UI to go through extra steps that are useless to me. First choice should be to skip this, second step should also have skip this etc...Too simple for the UI team that owns this project to stand up to the upper level.Fire TV UI to move/remove apps is horrible. Why not have the move option persist until the user is done moving apps. Why display the options to move and then give the all powerful “Are you sure” prompt after selecting it. Need to be able to remove proprietary apps that are not used nor will they ever be used. Hiding is at least something but if they are never going to be used seems like inefficient and ineffective design.Next is the remote. Why not give the ability to use the four hot keys as the user sees fit. I get the Prime Video self promotion but the others may not be used.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2022
author: ScratchThat

review_title: Forget this device if you use Disney+
review_text: I’ve used Fire Sticks for years and even used it with Disney+…until about a month ago when I got an error code 83. I went back into my bedroom and checked the Firestick there too. Same error code 83. I followed all of the Disney+ Help Center directions and none worked. I googled the issue and tried all of the suggestions. None worked. Finally I broke down and called Disney+. After 45 minutes with tech support they said since I can watch Disney+ on my computer, I’m receiving the service that I’m paying for and there’s nothing they can do to help.DO NOT buy this device if you want to watch Disney+. You will eventually be disappointed.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2022
author: Brad Morris

review_title: I love the Fire stick...you can keep Alexa
review_text: This Firestick solved a lot of our viewing problems. Previously I had been streaming most of my content providers through my old DVD machine but one by one they stopped working on that platform. Sometimes they just said we can no longer play on this machine, others just would stall constantly during the stream, which was annoying to say the least. Now we have access to everything and it all works very well. I think the "Alexa / Siri" stuff is as creepy as can be and refuse to use them...instead I block the microphone. I don't trust big tech as far as I can spit. Yes, I am old and a crank. Love the Firestick though!
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2022
author: Kindle Customer

review_title: Low Quality Remote, Everything else Works as Advertised
review_text: This product worked pretty much as advertised. The sole issue i had was poor manufacturing quality for the remote control. The primary, center button doesn't seem to fit into the remote very well, like it catches on the arrow buttons next to it. So, when you push the button down, the button also randomly depresses an arrow key, making your on-screen selection go haywire. For instance, you hit the main button to select a show, but instead, the remote sends the "go up" command than then "select the show", so you get the wrong show. This happens two out of three button pushes. Low quality control from manufacturing.I put in a request with Amazon, their automated system said it would send a replacement, but now I can't find a record of that and my return window has closed.Hopefully this is a one-off manufacturing issue and not present on a large number of remotes.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2022
author: Andrew P. Frits

review_text: This makes a huge difference in picture quality! We got a new 4k TV but we could not download the sling app so we used our old firestick. It didn't look right so we purchased this and it looks perfect. All for that one app, lol. We are able to download all the apps we use and they all look great using this firestick so we just use this so we can use just 1 remote. It connects fast and is super easy to program.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022

review_text: installed and works fine. We did have an issue with fire stick not going farther than select language screen because remote would not connect to fire stick at all. It turned out to be a silly reason why on their part, it was because we didn’t use the power cord that came with this particular fire stick!! we used the one from our previous 4k fire stick that looks exactly the same but, apparently it is oddly not on the inside.love the extra buttons, the live tv guide one is very handy. Would be great if in future the buttons where color coded and allowed us to program them with what app we want to automatically load..

author: Casper & Boo

review_text: I bought a third Fire Stick to replace one of my older ones. I specifically bought this because it has the volume and power buttons integrated with your TV. I know only need to use one remote in bed instead of reaching for the others in the dark of night. All else performs exactly as I expected, just quicker and smoother than the older generation of Fire Stick. If you are considering getting into an Amazon Fire Stick, you can't go wrong with this model.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2021
author: frknswt

review_title: Fire Does Not Navigate Well + Cannot Remember Login Information!
review_text: Yes, Fire and competing devices are a nifty idea; and necessary given the structure of our television programming. However, Jeff Bezos did not do his homework on the Fire TV device. It frequently gives me trouble when going to CNN because it cannot remember that my CNN access is thru a cable provider. It is consistently frustrating!It is also clunky when navigating to many platforms. It just seems to not know how to understand where you want to go; what you want to connect to. I believe that part of this problem is that it quickly fills the screen with content that Amazon or some other paying customer wants to sell.So - come on Jeff Bezos. The technology needed here is nothing new. Please improve Fire!

author: WiseOldOwl?

review_title: We don't use Alexa but the rest is great
review_text: We have older plasma this (they came with the house) and our old fire TV stick couldn't adjust the volume . But that's apparently been solved in the newest generation. Very happy.We don't use the Alexa feature mainly because I haven't taken to voice commands yet. So I can't speak to that. Though every time I am at a house that has echo or Alexa it seems to work mostly well.Only I didn't understand what would happen if I "copied" our Currently existing firestick so I didn't. That meant doing the full set up process. Not difficult just more time than the "copy" feature.

author: Annette B

review_title: Like turning your TV into a brand new set!
review_text: Well for one, the set up was a piece of cake. I have an older model Visio TV and I worried that some of the apps that are available through the Fire stick would not stream to it -as I had difficulty before with the LITE version of the Fire stick, which was returned and refunded, without any difficulty, as usual ~ (Thank you, Amazon CS). But this new upgraded Amazon Fire stick is the cat’s meow! The streaming quality is ‘picture-perfect’, and although I do not use the Alexa voice control too often, it is very responsive when I do. So far, this is, without question, the best model put out yet! I highly recommend this new and upgraded model!

review_text: It is amazing that recent Fire TV update made the watchlist menu disappeared. You can still add shows to a watchlist, but you just cannot show the watchlist. What a nice feature!!!Also, moving the menu bar to the middle of the screen is plain stupid. Fire TV being slow is already a problem. It will overshoot if you use the scroll button to move to the menu bar because of the delayed in feedback. You have to hit the home button every time to access it. Also, most of the space on the menu is occupied by icons that I do not click, but the menu items that I use have disappeared.My most used features are recently watched and my list. But those are either hard to find or disappeared now. Thank you!!!

review_text: this is so much better than the previous model. responsiveness is wonderful and quick, no issues with freezing up or randomly disconnecting from wifi and having to be reset so far. the only problems I've run into, and I'm not positive it isn't just the apps, YouTube doesn't really work playback wise. I can open the app, search for videos, but when I go to play the video it just keeps buffering. the other is that sometimes, after playing for a while, video audio and picture won't be synced. again, I don't know if this is because of the apps themselves or the firestick, but overall im very satisfied. definitely worth the buy.

Watched shows, great stuff.UNFORTUNATELY this turned out to be THE WAY.Have to unplug and replug at least 3 to 7 times EVERY TIME I USE IT to get it to function. author: Jason L.

review_text: Bought one for the living room TV and one for the playroom. The setup is straightforward and overall experience is polished. These replaced a Roku 4200 and Roku Express because neither worked with Disney plus. The remote is almost identical but a little lighter though it feels good in the hand. I like that the remote can control the TV power and volume so I don't have to use 2. My biggest gripes are that prime video and voice recognition don't work on kids accounts. I tried giving the kids a regular account but it's too easy for them to sign up for premium subscriptions and purchase episodes without knowing.

author: Kevin Miller

review_text: My fifth Fire TV Stick and my third 4K one. Overall, I like the Fire TV Sticks and they generally integrate well with Alexa.Works well with Netflix, Apple TV, Paramount +, HBO Max, and almost all other apps I use on it. With one notable exception…My biggest complaint with this Amazon stick is a problem opening the Amazon Music app. Every other time (literally) I want to use Amazon Music, I have to reboot the stick to get Music to open. Probably an app issue, since all other apps work fine on it.I’m happy with streaming video quality on my Samsung QLED TV.

author: K. Bennett

review_title: Stop waiting for your old Firestick to stop buffering. Get a new one!
review_text: Stop waiting for your old Firestick to stop buffering. Get a new one! After weeks of our screen freezing and seeing the spinning <U+0001F635><U+200D><U+0001F4AB> streaming equivalent of a “ lose a turn” card every time we tried to watch something, I decided to trade in our old Firestick for a new one. No more buffering!! No more getting booted and no more freezing!! We even bought a second one for my daughter’s indoor/outdoor projector. It works perfectly and was super easy to set up. There is definitely a noticeable difference in performance between the new and old Firestick versions. Do yourself a favor and upgrade!

author: S. Maguigan

review_text: Just as the two Rokus I went through frequently lost connection after a few months, so does the Firestick. They seem to “wear out”. Purchased just before Christmas 2021. It is now 3/11/22 and the Firestick has already started freezing every 30 seconds or so. The streaming picture is fine when it’s not frozen. Other than that, I’m not really into “Start/Stop” programming. I prefer to see a steady moving picture. NO, there is nothing wrong whatsoever with my WiFi output. In fact, it’s been upgraded. I guess the next step is to go all out and buy a smart TV… see how long that lasts.

review_text: This is garbage and I’m really sad that Amazon is even continuing to sell it. We have had ours for less than a year and have continued to have problems with it. author: Theresa

review_title: Very poor Wifi Hardware in this device
review_text: I purchased 4k version to upgrade from the first generation Fire Stick, because the new interface was causing a lot of lag. I figured a new stick with a better processor would be better.I got the 4k device connected it to my TV and connected to my router. At best I could get a good connection. I pulled it off and reconnected my old first generation Fire Stick and I got a very good connection. Also, I have a Roku 4 connected to the TV that connects with an excellent connection. I plugged the 4k back in and started to try and watch some shows on Prime and Netflix. After 5 minutes the connection had dropped to fair and it wouldn't connect to the internet.I looked at all of the suggestions to help with the connection status (published by Amazon) and realized it was all an attempt to gaslight owners of the 4k into thinking the problem is with their router (move the router closer, add a repeater, connect with ethernet cable, blah, blah, blah). Two other older devices connect to my router with great success, but the latest 4k stick is having issues.DO NOT BUY THIS DEVICE. The Wifi hardware in the device is bad and Amazon won't admit that they have a bad product.Wait for the next generation and hope they get it right.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022
author: Desert Lion

We use the remote for opening apps (when we know what we’re looking for) and for TV control while watching, but use the voice recognition for searching quickly.Overall we’re very happy with this purchase and have one on every TV in the house!

review_title: Love the new features and volume on remote

Remote is very response and added plus to have volume control finally. I gave it four stars since I really wish Amazon would redesign the stick itself. It is annoying to fit it in properly to the tv ports or if my tv is flat on the wall. The additional connector just makes it stick out from the side and just gets in the way and looks unprofessional. This needs a different design.

author: JewlzieB

review_text: This is the third one I've purchased in two years to replace others that stopped working. Consistent streaming issues, always saying my internet connection is slow, or not connected. Constant interruptions during streaming.I've called support, they taught me how to update the stick and also to restart it. It helps for a short time (sometimes a few days, sometimes not at all).I blamed it on having crappy internet (even though I have the highest speed possible), until last night. I got fed up and disconnected it from my TV, using only the TVs internet connection, and now everything works fine, no streaming issues and apps respond immediately.The user interface is great, but I won't use or purchase again until they troubleshoot the connection issues.

author: Elisha

review_text: My 2nd gen (refurbished, IIRC) lasted 3 years, so I got my $$ worth. The 4k stick is a significant upgrade. Processes faster for better streaming quality and more efficient in general. Alexa voice control is much better and doesn't lag like my 2nd gen did. Volume and on/off controls (mostly) eliminate the need for my TV remote and the shortcut buttons at the bottom are very useful with Netflix, Hulu, Prime and Disney+. My only complaint is there doesn't seem to be a sleep timer like my two Insignia Fire TVs have, so that's the only purpose my Vizio remote serves.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2022
author: AGon7

review_text: I got this to take with us when we travel so that we always have our shows and movies for after the day's activities are done.The device works as expected, is fast, and has enough space for the various streaming apps. I have never had an issue with this device overheating or with the overall functionality of the device or remote. I like that it is small and easy to tuck away in our travel kit.Overall, I highly recommend this device if you are in the market for a streaming device to take on the road with you or even to use at home; it works great there too!

review_title: Hard to set up but great now that it is working
review_text: My sister has a Fire Stick and talked me into buying one. I was very excited when it arrived (quickly). But I was on the phone with her for 90 minutes before I managed to get it working. We have a separate receiver for our Sony smart TV. And it is set up so that all inputs go through the receiver to the TV (even video). So even after we finally got the video to show correctly, we had a hard time figuring out how to get the audio correct. It kept wanting to use our DirectV audio. Anyway, it finally works!! The best feature is being able to talk our commands.

review_text: Bought this to FINALLY upgrade from my Gen1 Fire tv box. With the promo that was running that day I got it free so I thought it was time. Someone complained somewhere that you can’t switch tv inputs with this but I found, by accident, that it does work 1 way on my tv. I can switch directly from tv input to Fire just by hitting one of the streaming shortcuts on the remote. Unfortunately it doesn’t work in reverse that I’ve found. All in all I’m glad I made the jump to 4k!

review_text: The firestick works just fine. It does what it's supposed to do.My issue is the remote control. Every time I press a button I'm fully expecting the remote to completely crumble. And on top of that the price is double what it was just a few short years ago. I'm not impressed at all. Come on Amazon get your act together. I remember when manufacturers and sellers used to be proud of their products. Unfortunately we live in a different world. The toys I had as a kid were built of better materials. But I digress. The fire stick works as it should, just not too sure how long the remote will last.

My Apple TV 4K works much smoother and I prefer it for my main TV streaming but the Fire stick is best for streaming to a kid’s room or if you want a more cost effective way to stream content.

review_text: We received this as a new item on January 2nd and were excited to get it to replace an older model which had stopped working. The replacement arrived quickly but to our disappointment a 3 month old item was replaced with a refurbished item. So we have a defective unit and we get someone else's defective unit as a replacement. The replacement we could not get the remote to pair up with the refurbished unit and support indicated that the remote must also be bad and are sending a new one which will take 6 days to get here. Honestly I am extremely disappointed in Amazons response to this problem.

Go for it!
