review_title: Great Improvements over the Previous Firesticks
review_text: I am very satisfied with my Firestick 4K. The Hulu, Netflix, and Prime buttons provide 1-Touch opening of those apps, and make switching apps a breeze. Easy set-up, especially if you already have another Firestick registered on your account. We have 3 Firesticks, 2 AppleTVs, and a Chromecast with GoogleTV and the Firestick more than holds its own. Its not as easy to add external memory as with the Chromecast device, but remember that adding memory to an AppleTV isn't even an option. Integration through Alexa with Echo Dots, smart switches, and front doorbell camera was a breeze. I can't recommend this device more.

review_title: Good performance but timeout is super annoying.

If you are watching a show or a recording on a streaming service and you want to pause it to come back later to continue watching, the device timeouts out and returns to the main screen where you have to re-select where you left off before you can resume watching.The voice recognition work well but only with certain streaming services. For example, voice recognition does not work for playback controls on Youtube TV.

author: LedHeadBruce

review_title: The price is very low to purchase the Amazon Fire Stick 4K with latest Alexa Voice Remote
review_text: We purchased an Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device with latest Alexa Voice Remote. It was very easy to set up. We used to have cable TV, then Dish Network, and last, we had Directv. We don't have any of those anymore because they were getting too expensive. So, we now only have (YOU TUBE TV) we have a smart tv plugged into the fire stick. So, purchasing the Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K streaming device with Alexa Voice Remote was the best decision we ever made! We love how you can ask Alexa to tune to whatever channel you want to watch. But Alexa doesn't understand channel numbers. So, you have to ask Alexa to Tune to (such as) CBS for channel 4 or like to Tune to TCM for channel Turner Classic Movies; and so on. We also can use the Alexa Voice Remote to get to other choices like Netflix and other choices of streaming services to watch. We also like how our new Amazon Fire Stick 4K streaming device with Alexa; controls all of our remotes. We used to have to have one remote to turn on and off the tv; one remote to turn on and off our sound bar; and still another remote to turn on and off Directv. Now Alexa remote turns all of them on and off; besides changing channels; volume control, and recording programs, movies; tv shows, and then by playing them back and you can use the fire stick remote to fast forward past the commercials by only one remote from our Amazon Fire Stick 4K streaming device with Alexa remote! You only have to record one time. then Alexa remote will just keep recording all of the streaming that you record it to do. The remote can also stream music channels to listen too. Thank you, so much Amazon!

This starts up in seconds and is simple to use. I am definitely a fan. I have both Fire Sticks and Roku devices, they both have their pros and cons, but I don't rank one higher than the other.

author: Kathy Smith

review_title: FireTV stick 4K was delivered defective and Amazons response was 15% off next one I buy
review_text: FireTV stick 4K was delivered defective and never worked, no registration information or applications were ever downloaded, a 3 second fire tv logo is the only thing it would do... I tried searching online for a possible quick fix but the only option left was calling Amazons tech support and after an hour on the phone, nothing worked...unplug, wait10 minutes, plug back up, restart....change out adapter...change batteries...factory reset...etc... After being put on hold for another long period as he spoke to his supervisor, his response was that I needed to purchase another Firestick 4K with a 15% ...I thought this situation would have been made right by offering to send me a replacement Firestick 4K and a return postage box for the defective product...that way Amazons Quality Control could inspect and verify that it wouldn't boot up beyond the initial firetv logo...I guess it's just more convenient for them to resort to "plausible deniability" on their end and ignore my petty grievances as just someone trying to scam them for free merchandise or that through my own my error that made it defective. I've had 6 Firesticks over the past few years, mostly because of the generation upgrades and never have I experienced an issue like this... I've spent a great deal of time researching online for a solution...a great deal of time waiting on hold to speak to an Amazon representative...where I have to speak slow and simple English because it's to a foreign call center....constantly having to ask the technician to repeat because of accent or the limited basic vocabulary, especially having to translate technical terms all while being put on hold for lengthy periods of time made it extremely challenging...if not for optimistic hopes of possibly solving this problem soon then my patience would have gotten the best of me...Amazon failed in it's responsibility of ensuring quality service and product. I can assure you, my time invested in trying to make this right would equal 4 times the value in price I paid expecting a fully functioning Firestick 4K...and what aggravates me the most is that Amazon shows no effort in providing good customer service or responsibility in the quality of their products....Is it my integrity being questioned by some gaslighting Amazon employee over a 35 dollar transaction they failed to honor? dayKeep th' change, my integrity ain't for sale.Good day to you

review_text: Bought this to replace an older model, works great. Was easy to set up and navigate. Once I logged in with Amazon it downloaded all my apps I had before. I bought several, one for each TV in my house and will be sending back the cable boxes from the bedrooms because my kids only use this and weren't watching the cable anyway. Saves me the monthly fee for each room on cable. I can easily watch my cable channels with this by downloading the app and logging into my account. Very happy with this purchase.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2022
author: LEANDRA BURKS

review_title: Great for What It Does, But BEWARE INTERNET OVERAGES
review_text: As much as anyone else, I can say that I like this streaming device. It playbacks in great quality and it has everything you need to stream your favorite apps. Where the problem lies is with the amount of internet it uses. This is something Amazon won't tell you, but any of their streaming sticks throttle your wifi into itself. In just six hours total of using the stick, my family used up around 60% of our allowed data and we pay for 1.5TB of data. Not only that, but whenever it's on, it runs down the speed of every other device in the house. As of now, we've disabled the 4K quality and put it down to the weakest option. I haven't noticed a change in quality, but the internet usage has dropped tremendously. It still throttles quite a bit, but only around 35% a month.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2022
author: Dawson

review_text: Watching live TV isn't too bad, but watching recorded shows is very exasperating. About every 3-18 seconds, the program stops and goes into buffer mode. these last up to 28 seconds. If you try to fast forward during a commercial, it will go into buffer mode from3-36 seconds. An hour show takes one hour, 45 minutes to 2 hours to watch. I have tried watching several recorded shows, and this happens every time.Update. Live shows are now buffering. 3 1/2 hours to watch 3 one-hour shows, even with trying to fast-forward during commercials.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021
author: puttski

review_text: Worked well for our needs. Do not like you can't jump to the last channel using the remote however with technology and the 'recent used' channels we are ok with this. We were forced to switch to a streaming service and overall think this was a good change for what we needed. Would recommend to others and would probably purchase again. Like that we are able to use the carrier we selected and still be able to access Amazon movies and shows using the device. We haven't used Alexa feature yet.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2022

review_title: Great streaming device but small font

You cannot make it bigger but you can make a huge box appear in the middle of the screen that makes it bigger - however it makes the menu far less navigable. Once you get into the specific apps (e.g., Prime Video, Netflix) the font is the normal size for those apps so not a huge deal. Can use alexa to pick what you want!

After (30) minutes with the Tier I and then finally a stateside help agent, we came to the same conclusion that I'd ascertained an hour earlier - the unit was defective and required replacement. Fortunately the second one appears to be working ... for now.

Smart TV not required. Thank you. For the budget steaming solution for a fixed income individual.

As always there's a little time required getting all the "channels" and "apps" updated and loaded, and logged in, otherwise I highly recommend this device to turn any screen with an HDMI port into a "smart" TV.

review_text: I was floored by the choices that were mostly only available at an additional cost. I already have Netflix, and this thing knocked that right offline and it took me forever to get it working again. The menu is difficult to understand, and the minimal controls have to be memorized. Not worth the effort unless this is your only source of entertainment. I would never use Alexa or voice recognition because they don't do well with accents, so that's all just unnecessary fluff, as far as I'm concerned.

author: Carolyn

review_text: I've been using FireTV products for years and sync has been a recurring theme. However, I believed by buying these new Firesticks that the situation would at least improve. Not only is my audio and video consistently out of sync at a much higher rate (I can't watch more than 30 minutes of live TV on any app without it becoming unwatchable), but none of the fixes on Amazon or other support forums seem to provide a long term solution. I'm now stuck with a decision of overhauling all my devices to an similar device or suffering with a far-below-par system I paid for...pathetic product in this day and age.

author: John Cowsert

review_text: The Amazon Firestick 4K is really good. Once installed the Firestick comes with so many streaming networks that are free so that's a huge plus. If you have other streaming networks that you pay for it also plays those. You just have to download them under the app section and downloading the apps are free. Once downloaded, then just sign in and now you can watch what ever streaming networks you are paying for. The 4K part is really good. Not every show is in 4k though. Buy even if it's not in 4K the picture quality is still in 1080p HD. The Alexa part is very good as well. My wife and I love this Amazon Firestick 4K and definitely recommend it. Hope this helps.

I find both work extremely well.

author: Amazon Customer

review_title: Finally cut the cable and saved $$$
review_text: still getting used to this device. There is a bit of a learning curve as using it is not immediately intuitive. Every so often, I get lost in the work flow of the device between its home mode (Firestick) and what is has and my YouTubeTV streaming app, with all the latter's content and 85+ channel live TV lineup. I can't compare it to ChromeCast or other devices, but I don't think you will be dissatisfied with it once you become accustomed to it. If you have a family member who needs the ultimate simplify of a very intuitive interface (i.e. computer challenged) , this device (and perhaps some others) may be a bit much for them. But to be fair, you may be able to set up a profile for them specifically that makes navigation much more simple by limiting content to what they only want. BY THE WAY, cutting the "cable cord" is also cutting my cable bill by 50%. Lastly, Firestick significantly improved picture quality ...even beyond that of fiber based services. I had FIOS.

author: Kindle Customer

review_title: Remote control is not user friendly for the older generation
review_text: My parents just went through a big move. The tv, internet and phone was a new service for them. The tv is thru a company called comporium. They were given a Firestick for this new cable tv service. I thought this would be great because there are no boxes to deal with or satellite dish. Well, I was wrong. I set up the firesticks for both tv’s and their streaming app comporium. My mom had a little trouble at first, but she’s getting the hang of it, but my dad, dear lord help us all. Is there a remote that is user friendly for the older generation that suffers dementia? We’re constantly in his room fixing his tv. He does not understand the remote. The buttons are so close together and he keeps hitting the wrong one. He only needs to press up or down on the ring to change the channel. Since the buttons are so close together, he’s constantly hitting the blue button or the home button. Please make a remote with the buttons spaced away from each other, for the older generation. The remotes now are too small and the buttons are too close together.

author: Randy

review_title: Easier to use than my previous ONN. device
review_text: This Fire TV Stick has three features that differ from my previous ONN. streaming device that make it easier to use. ("ONN." is a Walmart brand name.)1) The "mute" function on the ONN. would work only if first found and started streaming a video with music that the ONN. would recognise; then pressed the mute button while it was playing. If you started streaming any other video first, the ONN. would never activate the mute function. The Fire Stick mute button connects directly to the TV so it does not matter what videos are streaming.2) After using the ONN. for several months the ONN. upgraded its firmware. It seems that that upgrade caused it to have a limit to the number (or perhaps the total of minutes) of videos that could be watched. To continue I had to disconnect the power source for a few minutes. I have not seen this happen with the Fire Stick.One disadvantage of the Fire Stick is that it seems to detect when the TV is turned on and activates itself immediately. I have to turn off the Fire Stick if I want to watch something else, either from the other HDMI port or the USB port on the TV.The only draw-back is that the Fire Stick seems

review_title: Broke one month out of warranty
review_text: Starting just one month after the warranty expired the fire stick stop working (wouldn't load beyond the logo). Called Amazon support and the guy walked me through various trouble shooting steps and said he needed to escalate it and call me back the following day. When he didn't call me back, I called back myself and they didn't have a record of my conversation the day before. Ended up trouble shooting all over again only for them to conclude it was beyond help and all they could offer me was a 15% discount on a new firestick. That was the extent of their goodwill. Surely the design life of these products is greater than 1 month beyond their warranty.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2022
author: Gareth Kennedy

review_title: We are a Roku household. Decided to try the Amazon Fire Stick, got it on sale.
review_text: So far I have to say that I am happy that I tried the Amazon Fire Stick! We have always had Roku boxes in our home. I have to say that to me it seems a bit more complicated as far as the settings/display of where everything is located. It was also interesting to find out how to stream my computer to the fire stick. Now granted the roku you don't have to do anything to stream to it. Amazon Fire Stick you have to go into a setting and turn it on. But for me being a tech type person I figured it out quickly enough and so far so good with this product. I may be buying a couple more to replace my other roku boxes with Amazon Fire Sticks <3
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022
author: TigaHotty85

review_title: Cannot control bluetooth volume - buy Google Chromecast instead.
review_text: It's been 4 years since I am using my Samsung TV w/o any additional speakers; it's a mess to setup different remotes and Bluetooth just doesn't work: needs reconnect on each power up and anyway, cannot control volume.Same with this Fire TV or and previous. Chromecast didn't even have the selection of bluetooh.Finally comes this new ChromeCast TV w/ Remote. It keeps the connection. 40$ chromecast and 50$ Nest Audio and I got a good audio for my TV.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021
author: uzevla

review_text: The fire stick worked well for about a month or two. The image was clear and 4k did work. Then one day I started getting flickering off and on. I knew it had to be something with the resolution and I set it to 1080 for everything and that fixed it for a while. I changed HDMI ports and updated firmware and every possible thing I could. I tested my TV and the ports with my PS5 and it was fine so it was for sure the fire stick. The flickering started again about a week ago and just last night it died on me. Lasted less than 2 years. I would expect something for 40 to 50 dollars to last a little longer and work better. I will stick to my PS5 to watch my apps. Looks and runs better anyway. I will never buy a fire TV stick again...
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
author: Centrifikal

review_text: Have had a couple older fire sticks in the past but never with TVs control buttons. When I saw they made them with tv controls, all my prayers had been answered. Older tv that remote went out and couldn’t get universal remote to work it so sound was annoying when watching tv, up and down constantly. This was the perfect solution and very easy to connect. Problem was, the day after I received it and got to loving it, tv screen died so I had to buy a new tv. Since the new tv was smart, I no longer needed it. When I had to pay $7.25 to return I thought about just keeping it but simply didn’t need it any longer!

date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2022
author: Semaj

review_title: I like it better than Roku.
review_text: One thing I don't like about Fire TV is if you have super fast internet as I do, the 2 Fire TV sticks one with 4k and one without as with the Roku TV I have has an occasional buffering problem which can cause a lag. This only happens once in a while and I still like Fire TV and do save a lot of money each month over cable or satellite tv. I think the processors they use or the memory buffers they use still aren't quite there yet to keep up with 100 mbs or faster internet speeds. Since I have had the exact same problem with all 3 streaming media devices I have used and tried several solutions to the problem which haven't worked then this is most likely the problem. Perhaps it doesn't happen with other types of streaming media devices but I'm not going to buy anymore at this point and hopefully technology will improve. Overall I still like the Fire TV stick over Roku because Roku doesn't have an internet browser and Fire TV does.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2022
author: nighthawk

review_text: This firestick replaced an older model, which was working fine. I have had nothing but issues with this new one. Continually buffers and needs to be rebooted. Called the number provided for support and they're offering me a refurbished model. I'm not interested in a refurbished. I paid for a new one. I am 10 days our of my return date and Amazon wants to take a percentage off. Not acceptable. Now I am stuck with a defective device.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2022
author: Laurasia

review_title: I wanted a faster firestick than my old one, and this one is, BUT - the picture ruins it.
review_text: I just wanted a faster connection than my old firestick (2nd gen) but didn't think that they picture would actually be different, but it is. The new firestick is doing what a lot of the new TVs are doing, tweaking brightness and color so much that it is ruining movies that I have been watching for years that I loved and making them practically unwatchable. They have made greens, yellows, and sometimes reds garish and overly bright, they have made the images either too dark or too washed out and I can't fix it on my monitor. I have the brightness down to zero and it's still to bright and that's not right. It makes me want to go back to cable it's so messed up. I think it also messed up my old firestick that I loved with an update so now it is too bright. The colors are just all off. I don't know what Amazon is trying to do but this cannot be a sellable product if it is ruining movies. I hope they get enough complaints and fix what it is they did so we can have our old displays back.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2021
author: denisejt

review_text: This new version has slippery buttons, harder to get pattern recognition without looking at the buttons your pushing since they're bunched together as the older version had buttons in a configuration that was easy to memorize without constantly looking at the remote to make sure I'm pushing the correct button and not either muting the sound or completely exiting the App back to the home screen which is so annoying....just my opinion and hope it helps.

A MAJOR DISSAPOINTMENT!

review_title: When it worked it was great. It was defective and was VERY hard to return.

I hung up and it worked for about 30 minutes, I was told by technical support if it did it again it was defective. So, I go in and you have to call to return it, called technical support worked on it for about 45 minutes and she decided it was defective and put through a exchange. She sent me a remote NOT a firestick. Had to call a third time to return. I just did a refund it was to much trouble. Amazon customer service is getting really bad.

Sometimes a restart doesn't work the first time.After I stopped the tv cable service with Comcast, I was surprised to receive a free streaming box which does everything the Firestick does. review_title: Why Do I Have To Write A Review?
review_text: Aren't my 5 stars enough? Isn't a simple review with stars good enough? Most people know exactly how this streaming device works. Those who don't probably aren't buying this. So, 5 stars should just about do it. If I were Amazon, I'd change the review system so that a written review is OPTIONAL. That way, your editors don't have to read meandering reviews like this one and then decide whether to approve it or not.

author: Amazon Customer

review_text: I have had it for 3 months now. I steam live TV and I watch a lot of sports. The Firestick freezes up when streaming live TV. At first I thought maybe it’s my internet but I have a small smart TV in a room upstairs on a WiFi connection and it never freezes up while the Firestick is downstairs sitting 12 inches from the router and freezes up every single time. This is my second Firestick, I was hoping the newer model would work better. If you only stream prerecorded material like Netflix it works good but occasionally the app will freeze and when you exit the app it does not close it. If the app freezes you have to unplug the Firestick to restart the app, but to be fair this is minimal. Over all if you want to stream live TV spend the money to get a smart TV or be prepared for the frustration of it freezing, usually at the most critical part of the game.

review_text: It is a big upgrade from the one I purchased 8 years ago but not easy to install and integrate with Firebox DVR. Called the help line and a real person answered. Unfortunately, they were no help and wanted me to use Alexa to figure it out. In the end, I rebooted everything, and it worked. It also seems to phase a lot and seems to be re-started a fair amount, frustrating.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2022
author: T McCann

review_title: Works great. (Can get lost in your couch)
review_text: Works really well and I like the updated buttons that take you straight to Disney+ or Netflix. Nice feature. Amazon should add a vibrate or alarm signal on the their remotes for when you may lose them. That's my idea for ya!As a fix we attached ours to a string attached to the couch so we can't lose it anymore. It's so sleek and small it dives into cracks like that old penny and Cheeto you lost.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2022
author: Amazon Customer

review_text: I just cut the cord, no more cable! So I am getting used to streaming, it’s been a month now and I am so happy! Took a little getting used to not having my dvr but the fire stick is so easy to use! Wish that I would have done this years ago! I could probably have taken a great vacation. I am saving about $100 a month and still get the shows that I like. Best move ever

review_text: Remote was flakey until it has finally died. The stick just goes to La-la land when using our Harmony remote. It hangs and will not respond to buttons being pressed. The tv light flickers with button presses so I know the harmony remote works. A replacement firetv remote is expensive. Might as well buy a whole stick/remote again. Stuck in the firetv realm.

review_text: Doesn not work! Worthless like everthing else amazon is selling. Annoying and does not work. I will burn it in a fire in the back yard. Sooo done w garbage reviews and Chinese products.

author: Rudy

review_text: I was hesitant to purchase a Fire Stix because of my lack of technology skills. After further inquiries I decided I had the necessary brain power to install and use.The amount of money I have saved using the Fire Stix versus cable is worth every penny spent to purchase. The freedom to choose what I want to watch and when is the greatest plus.

author: grannysandy

review_text: If anyone needs to customize thier firestick, look up someone named Uktechdoctor. He'll show you how to put your own homescreen (launcher) on the firestick all absolutely free! Easy as a click of a button. Now I can customize what apps I want, what shape I want them in, folders and categories. He's got tools to debloat and run cleaners and scan. All legit. All legal.Your welcome!

author: Backyard_Remedies

review_title: This works and can now cancel my cable television.
review_text: As of today I still pay for Comcast cable tv. I bought the Amazon stick to test whether my internet signal was strong enough to use the Amazon stick. And yes it was, so I plan on canceling cable television and only retaining internet. Will save me a lot of money. Only problem is that the Stick had some trouble recognizing one of my tvs, but it eventually did.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
author: RN

review_text: Seems to load the various apps quicker and plays just fine. Don't use it for 4k so can't comment on that. Bought to replace an older FireTV that just quick working despite all kinds of attempts to fix. Went through the tech folks at Amazon and they helped to diagnose the old one, and we ended at a dead end, but they gave me a discount towards a new one instead! Not bad Amazon, not bad.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2021
author: J. Moen

review_text: Wanted to cut the cable after years of complaining about cost, unwatched channels, etc. Were looking at newSmart TVs, but decided to try the FireStick to our 10-year old Samsung. Super easy to install, and we added the YouTube/YouTube TV app, plus Netflix which we already had, and couldn’t be happier! I’m convinced the picture quality is sharper than with cable, and it’s easy to use.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2021
author: Atlanta Al

review_title: Worthless In Less Than Three Weeks
review_text: We had this thing for 19 days and it started crashing. Did the arbitrary troubleshooting steps, checked for updates, checked WiFi, checked power supply, etc., no luck. Called customer service and they had me do a factory reset, which erased all my apps, logins and everything. Representative was extremely condescending and less than sympathetic to the issue with a less than three week old device.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2021
author: Robert

review_title: The add ons are SO USEFUL
review_text: Stream quality is much faster than the previous version, there is no doubt about that. But the best improvement is being able to switch between Disney Netflix or Hulu without having to wait for the home to load. Definitely worth it. Also I like the upgrade on their interface, even though that is across all devices, I do appreciate the improvements in the whole streaming experience.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2022
author: Bettina A. Requena Capote

review_text: We purchased the fire tv stick to take with us when traveling. It’s been great! Some hotels we stay at do not offer a good selection of tv programming and the fire stick fills that void. Note: You do need some basic tech skills to hook the fire stick to the tv and connect it to the hotel internet. There are some good YouTube videos that will walk you through doing that.
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022
author: Krissy P.

review_title: The remote does not work unless I take the batteries out and put them back in
review_text: I never had this problem with my previous Fire Stick remote, but there is something wrong with this one. EVERY time I want to use it, including changing a station, I have to take the batteries out and put them back in. EVERY TIME!!! The batteries aren't dead, because they work in other appliances, but this remote is just jacked up. I looked for help, there is none. This remote is the very worst part of my purchase, otherwise the streaming is great.
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2022
author: Cheri Clifton

review_text: Amazon removed sound from most movies on Prime, IMDB and Netflix. Laughing! I had the 2nd generation model. That was their "silent" hint for me to upgrade. Linda [Customer Service] was thorough in knowledge and assistance! It's a small investment for in home entertainment. Easier/quicker to set up than previous model and battery compartment is much easy to open.
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2022
